Reviews.Title: “Would you Stay in a Hotel Like this?”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: The room was nothing like the website advertised. It was small and claustrophobic. I had to walk sideways between the bed and the wall to get to the other side of the room (I'm a size 8 - 10). We could hear the lift from our room, and we were over the other side of the hotel. The toilet did not flush properly. We felt very unsafe and did not sleep well at all. We came home after the first night there. As you can see from our photos - we just couldn't stay there. We asked to upgrade (as the website showed some nicer rooms). The member of staff told us we were in their 'best set of rooms'. If we were in their best set of rooms, I wander what their worst set of rooms was like! Breakfast was awful. There were a handful of croissants and danishes - these were stale. We had saucers for plates.There was no meats or cereal as you might expect from a continental breakfast, which is what we were advised we were getting. If you were staying here for one night, to continue your travels the next day, you may be able to just manage a night there. But as for a holiday hotel - no way.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: sweetie_candykim
Reviews.Content: IWe booked this hotel because it was the cheapest we could find. Then we looked at the reviews on here and was dreading it, but the hotel was not that bad. It doesn't deserve the bad reviews, but I'll try and be as honest as possible. The rate was £39 for a non-refundable double room. This ended up being a double room with twin beds pushed together. It actually worked out better because we wanted a twin room but it cost more. The hotel is very close to everything, a 10 minute walk to the pantheon, 25 min walk to the Vatican, 15 minute walk to the Colosseum etc. There are also several buses that go past but we only used them once. The entrance to the hotel is down a narrow corridor lodged inbetween two cafés which leads to a small reception area. The reception is absolutely nothing like the pictures on the website, but that doesn't matter! you don't hang around in the reception! We got a room on the second floor. The corridors have loads of modern art hanging up. It is quite unusual, a bit weird (because it is a hotel) but interesting too. There were some seats on the second floor which I saw people sitting and using their laptops (presumably to get better wi-fi or in my case signal for my phone). The room was small but adequate. The 'double' bed was acually 2 twin beds. There was a small stain on the duvet but it was under the cover thing and I didn't actually notice it for a couple of days so it didn't bother me really. We also had a blanket because it was freezing when we were there. The room itself though was actually really stuffy. It was good when we were there because it was cold but I dread to think what it would be like in the summer. I think there was air-con but I didn't really have a look. The bathroom was small but fine. The shower was a half-bath thing. I am not sure how you would actually use it but we just used the shower. It did make the floor wet, but just don't put your clothes on the floor! my friends had a proper shower with a curtain. The room didn't smell until the last night. The last night had an awful smell in the bathroom, and I thought I would air it out but this made the entire room smell. But it was the last night so it wasn't that big a deal. The paint on the wall was a bit scuffed, but nothing a lick of paint wouldn't fix. The cleaner cleaned our room, made the bed, emptied the bin and cleaned the bathroom everyday so the service wasn't terrible. We didn't have to ask for anything else. However when my friends room key stopped working she just told her room number to the receptionist and she changed it, without checking! A man kept lurking outside their room too and rung their phone. So that was a bit worrying, but nothing happened, so it could have been nothing. The hotel was fine if you just want to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: cinziaz123 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: The room are simple but the location is fantastic and for the price we paid it was more than ok

Reviews.Title: “So expensive for such a bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: johanna0107
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one of the best locations in rome but how awful it is! The room was 5 square meter, bed is almost on the wall so no space at all! Service is useless, nothing is made to have your stay comfortable. Book this hotel if you need a great location but not for the room and service. We paid 129 euros for a night... It is a total wripe off

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful!”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel by myself for a couple of nights - and, apart from the central location, I have nothing nice to say about this place! First of all, you can hear just about everything happening on your floor and if you are lucky like me and have a room next to a toilet is not very pleasent at all, especially not if you are trying to sleep. Second night there I woke up by an awful smell coming from my bathroom, there must have been a problem with their sewage system or something. There was a hole in my door and the bed felt like a plank. The worst hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed..”
Reviews.Author: Luz409
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on November 2011. The only reason we stayed here was because we're only staying two days in Rome and knew the location was rated pretty good. Had no time to waste traveling long distances to the turist sites. I will never stay here again and would not even recomend it to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, if you can.”
Reviews.Author: Leko_24
Reviews.Content: It's a tiny little hotel in a great location however the staff are so unpleasant and the hotel just seems to go out of their way to screw you over. There is no one on staff you can escalate any issues to. Dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: mainiac027
Reviews.Content: Wow-location can't be beat! Directly across from the huge white Victor Emmanual and Unknown Soldier monument built by Mussolini. We loved being in the heart of the old city-walk everywhere in 5-15 mins (colosseum, forum, palatine hill,pantheon)just 20 mins the other way to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steppes a few seconds walk to the bus stop or Metro just around the corner. We had room 308-quiet, adequate-I would ask for it again-especially after seeing the earlier Trip Advisor reviews Truly,the room needs a major re-hab, but was very clean-queen size bed very comfortable, room usual european size, but room for luggage and to hang clothes and a small desk and seat-2 night tables , flat screen tv-we didn't use it- Charming window overlooks the piazza and a patch of green lawn beside the V-E. monument. We kept it open to catch the night breeze, but noise woke us around 4 A.M. with street sweepers, etc.-closed it and slept soundly until 8 both days. Can't comment on air-conditioning as it was off for the season. Maid service is very good-fresh,large bath towels each day-linens done up freshly each morning(we stayed 2 days) The shower is quite tricky in that you have to climb in over the edge like getting into a tub but is only a shower of maybe 32-34 inches diameter-really needs a wall bar for balance getting in and out and a longer shower curtain to catch run-off. Bathroom is tiny(!) and the ceiling over the shower needs to be patched and re-painted- There was plenty of hot water and good pressure. We paid $250/nite for the room- was very quiet, near elevator and we did not need to use cabs or any transportation other than walking-so saved on those expenses-besides we were in the heart of one of the world's major cities...so I guess that was a good rate for a 3 star hotel. Elevator was safe, roomy and fast. Breakfast was a typical continental-good tasting, hot American coffee, tea, juices and fresh rolls. Plenty of breakfast and lunch areas all around the hotel, so not a problem getting a large breakfast if you wanted one. The staff was professional and on duty 24-7. The lobby is as expected for older, in-town hotel, but not as pictured. Very tiny, actually-but has all you want-maps, etc so to sum up- amazing location; old hotel, needs to be up-dated; very clean, comfortable bed; basic but nice self-serve breakfast -good coffee! decor - out-sized paintings- mostly portraits- hung everywhere-would have preferred relaxing scenes of Italy or the city surround, but to each his own(the paintings are pictured in the write-up on-line so can't say we weren't warned!!!) each floor has a lounge-very basic wi-fi only on 2nd floor near lounge bring a converter for your phones, computer,etc. Not sure this hotel deserves a 3 star rating, but location and cleanliness do take the sting out

Reviews.Title: “More than value for money!”
Reviews.Author: magda m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days, booked a double room for a really nice price. We got a great suite with spacious bathroom and a jaccuzzi in bedroom. Bed was comfortable and big. Room and bathroom were new, clean and with warm water, towels were changed every day. Hotel staff friendly and polite. Breakfast was tipical italian, croissants, milk, coffee, tea, jam and provided with enough warm croissants all the time during breakfast period. Locatian couldn't be more perfect! Via del Corso, Pantheon, Colosseo, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna- all cca 10minutes walk! Definitely more than value for money! The only thing is the walls. White walls with a lot if bag and suitcases scratchs... they could really repaint it.

Reviews.Title: “If you like taking hot showers in the winter don't stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Padilha1977
Reviews.Content: Location and low price, these are the only two things going for this hotel. I didn't have hot water in my moldy old bathroom for 2 days in a row. I stayed there in Dec 2010, half of the staff was nice and the other half not so cool. This one nice old man who worked there let me take a shower at another empty room's bathroom when I didn't have hot water in mine in the end of the day (he always worked nights, I though of him as my guardian angel in that hotel) because during the day the girls at reception would tell me that there is no hot water and the problem is being fixed blablabla and there was no way I could take a hot shower at that moment and no outside spas in the city they knew of etc...(in other words: no deal!). Hotel is noisy, dirty, old...what else can I say? Oh yes look at the pictures, they say more than a thousand words plus it's pretty cheap for the location (you get what you pay for with this one). Maybe it would be better and cleaner to stay at a hostel...

Reviews.Title: “The Real Piazza Venezia ‏”
Reviews.Author: Tomer2411
Reviews.Content: when you look at the site of this hotel in the internet you think this is a nice hotel but when you get there you are shocked!! it is definitely different from what you saw at the web, the room is small and narrow, the bathroom is very small and the bath is very very small (it is a half sitting bath that you can't stant at), and the sink Ceramics was broken!! the walls are dirthy, the air condition is opening when the hotel want to open it. and you have internet connection just in 1 place in the hotel near the elevator in floor 2 so you need to go there to get 1 line of connection Wifi. also the Chambermaids are working and doing noise till 16:00 everyday and because the doors of the room is very thin if you want to sleep in floor 2 after your flight you can't (the collection room of all the sheets from the hotel is there). the double bed is 2 single beds that combain together so you need to bring them closer each night when they are getting far. it is need to call motel and not hostel..it was ugly to be there, and because thery are calling themself 3 stars hotel you need to pay tax of 2 euro to the government about eveynight you sleep there, i asked other people about this hotel and they told me that in floor 4 you have dirty carpets at the rooms that they was Disgusted to step at them i saw hostels that is better than this hotel!!! my advice is to search other hotels in Rome that respect you and that publish truth in the internet site and not to get to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel that we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Apart from the fact that the sheets and the bathroom were clean there is very little to recommend this hotel. The photos on their official site are TOTALLY misleading - our room was room 514 - it was minute dark with little or no natural light - the carpet was heavily soiled on all the vislible areas - the air-conditioning vent was DISGRACEFUL and obviously has never been cleaned [this was visible from the bathroom]. The "view" we had was of some derelict buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Misleading”
Reviews.Author: Marnie P
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying in this hotel purely for the fact that their professional photos look NOTHING like the reality. After looking at the website and seeing the photos I booked two nights here for my stay in Rome, and was really disappointed. It was just so basic, which is fine if the price reflected that and the hotel gave a true indication of that on their website. My bathroom was not clean when I arrived and the shower was a pathetic dribble of lukewarm water. The shower itself was broken and just hung from it's cord down to the ground, so you were forced to hold it which made washing your hair a bit of a challenge. The girls behind the reception counter didn't seem to care and when I asked for an iron they just said 'No iron'. Not, sorry we don't actually have one, just a 'No iron'. Wifi was only on the second floor, the lift was painfully slow and breakfast was extremely basic. For the price I paid, I defitely expected more. This place is more like a hostel than a hotel, the only thing it has going for it is an excellent location. Otherwise, I am very angry at the deception I feel that has occurred between what the hotel represents itself as and what it actually is. Bad all round.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: em83ma
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that's close to all the main sites, then this is the one. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colluseum and The Vatican all within easy walking distance (5-15 mins). The hotel room itself was really poor. We were on the 4th floor and our room was tiny (more like a cupboard) with no window and very small shower room. The hotel also used to turn off our air con at night, and with 35+ plus weather in August this was unbearable. We only stayed here for 4 nights and I'm thankful we hadn't booked it for any longer. As I said, the best location in Rome!! It depends what you're willing to sacrifice for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that is all that is good...”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Piazza Venezia with a friend for 3 nights following 4 nights in the mountains for a friends wedding. I would agree with all of the reviews that say this hotel is in a great location. It is, you couldn't be more central. However......I wouldn't recommend this as a place to stay. There is nothing special about it. It feels very much like a hostel. The rooms are really noisey as you can hear everything going on in the hallways. The aircon was working - bonus. However our maid each day opened our full length windows which reduced the impact that the air con had. This was also not great as our room had a walkway outside of the window that people could have used to climb into our room. The bed linen was clean and the the beds comfy. We did however only have 3 pillows between us....after asking each day, twice a day we finally got an extra pillow at midnight on the last night. The staff are not too helpful/rude and the lift is a death trap. The bathroom in our room was awful.....vile infact. The mirror was hanging off the wall and the shower curtain was 4 inch above the shower tray which resulted in the bathroom flooding every time you used it. Also you had to hold the shower head as the wall bracket was broken. Spend a little extra for an acceptable level of basic.....I don't mind budget, you get what you pay for but this really does take the biscuit! Spend your money somewhere else....you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing it has is the location”
Reviews.Author: FGE04
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small, the bathrooms are even smaller. Shower is a joke. I asked for a change of room given the pity bathroom in the first one and got a (slightly) bigger one with no curtain in the shower Everything quite old or rusty A/C works automatically, even at night, so you can not change it whatever you want. Yes, location is perfect. 5-10m walking to almost everywhere you might want to visit, but for this price you can get better hotels also centrally located. I wouldn´t recommend booking on this one

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel...ever!”
Reviews.Author: Gail D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May and as I sit here and read these reviews, I wish I had done more homework. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are small, but that would not have concerned me. It was the incredible rudeness of the desk staff that was so disconcerting. This was confirmed by another guest, so it was a relief that it was not my imagination or something I did to offend her. My bathroom flooded because the shower curtain is not large enough to contain the water. I am not a big person but I managed to leave quite a puddle on the floor that I felt responsible to clean up. Fortunately, I had soap with me because I was next travelling to an apartment. Good thing, because there was no soap provided by the hotel. Oh, and they advertise that they have free wifi, but I had to hike approximately one mile to an internet bar to actually use my computer. It is not reliable reception. I was thrilled that I had only booked one night.

Reviews.Title: “Location that's all!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaPerrone
Reviews.Content: Half of the staff was awesome but the other half not so much. I stayed there in the winter and my room didn't have hot water for two days in a row! Amazing! I had toyake a shower at another room. The room and the bathroom were old and dirty this place is a roach-motel! Price was the cheapest I could fife but you truly get what you pay for with this one so don't even think about staying there If you care a bit about minimal personal higene :(

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Superbluestar
Reviews.Content: I have very high standards about places I got to- I worry about how clean the facilities will be, would I get a decent sleep when I arrive at my accomodation for holiday. So I was scared when Piazza got such negative views. I was impressed! My room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The reception lady was so nice. It was in the heart of everything. I barely took bus to the highlights like Collosseum or Vatican City- I walked. The only let down was the shower... they had curtains so after showering huge puddle where on floor. The shower head looked a little mould and needed a clean! As for my sleep- not so good first night was noisy as on 2nd floor was the only WiFi access so people came up at night and made so much noise- called reception and within minutes it was quite, however there were a few bars they based music up so loud you didnt sleep till the bar shut! I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, shame about the disgusting customer service.”
Reviews.Author: charlotte170
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel as part of a 3 night break to Rome. On arrival at midday was told room not ready until 2pm and there was no safe holding place for our cases in the meantime and they were to be left in the entrance lobby to one side, and we could either sit with them or trust they'd be ok there unattended. Once we returned at 2pm and were shown our room we were shocked at the size of it, we weren't expecting anything massive but it was tiny with the smallest wetroom serving as a bathroom. It was clean enough but clearly had only been tidied and not properly cleaned before our stay, the floor was sticky and dirty and the walls were also dirty. our room was right next to a public toilet (mainly used by staff from the office right on the other side of our room) and the walls were paper thin and could hear the staff's very loud conversations and the phone constantly ringing. We then attempted to use the safe to find we needed to pay a 10euro deposit for, though when we tried were told very rudely by the receptionist that the key had been lost and there wasnt one and we were to leave our money in our room or carry it with us. we then saidwe wanted to be moved to a room with a safe and not next to an office and often used toilet to be told every room was now occupied (though this was 20mins after we had just been able to check in) and we were to come back tomorrow for a room change. so we went out for the day and evening and returned for an early night. once we'd settled into bed we soon realised how thin the walls were and were kept awake by constant loud use of the toilet by seemingly several people at once having extremely loud conversations. we soon grasped that this toilet had a door leading onto an outside balcony which was being used for smoking on ( and the balcony ran right under our window so anyone could come to the window and look in/climb in if the window was left open, which it had to be as the aircon was also not working!) by this point after been up very early for the flight and out all day a member of staff in the office right next to us on the other side decided to put their stereo on full volume and treated us to some lady gaga at 11 of a night! we had to get out of bed go round the corner and tell them to turn it down. had the worst nights sleep ever thanks to constant talking/banging/shouting going on in the toilet next door and the hardest bed ive ever slept on with only one pillow each. The next morning went to the reception to see which room we were been moved to only to be told we now weren't been moved and had to stay where we were. by this point was extremely angry and insisted on speaking to a manager, who finally agreed to move us but told us it was to a room with no window as such, just one skylight, which was (if possible) even smaller! And also this room also didnt have a safe with a key and the fridge wasnt working. but this we were told was our only other option. we took this room if only to guarantee some form of a quiet nights sleep that night. the room again was suitably clean and tidy but not amazingly so. Ive stayed in many hotels and am well aware that for a central location, which it really is, then you have to make some concessions. and for a 3 star hotel was adaquete. but the main thing that ruined this hotel for me was the first room position (if going to stay DO NOT stay in room 238) and the appalling attitude from the staff. everything seemed to exasperate them and they were extremely rude when speaking to you, didnt want to help in any form and any concerns fell on deaf ears. ( and throughout our stay we noticed a few times customers attempting to raise concerns unsuccessfully to the staff) a real shame as the location couldnt be better, you really are in the heart of Rome and would be an amazing place to stay if the staff actually cared about their customers stay. I have not exaggerated in any way and this is the first negative review ive ever wrote, but felt it had to be shared.

Reviews.Title: “We do not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: clgarb111
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed upon our arrival at this hotel. We booked this hotel because my travel partner had stayed here three years ago and had a good experience. Unfortunately the hotel has changed and has gone downhill drastically. Upon arrival we were told that the suite we had booked could be available but there was no air conditioning. They were not sure if the air conditioning would be fixed in the next three or four days. They offered us a standard room in the meantime which was extremely small with a moldy tiled bathroom. We got up the next morning and cancelled our reservation and moved to another hotel. Until major repairs and extensive cleaning is done I would not suggest ever staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveller1000
Reviews.Content: If you dont want your holiday to be a total waste and a miserable one..then PLEASE do not stay at this hotel. It was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in! The rooms were microscopic, there was not even room to move around at all. The AC was not working, and when it actually did-it was bringing it hot air.We were dreading going back to the hotel every night! Rooms are filthy! and to top it all off we actually saw bed bugs..after spending several nightes itching like crazy! And I tried to write a review about this to warn others, but i think the hote wouldnt give authorisation to publish it..I wonder why??! The area is great, and there are alot of other hotels there, such as Cosmopolita and others..I say search for a 4star hotel at least if you are going to Rome, because even their 4 star-is not the same standards as another 4 star in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely do not choose this accomodation”
Reviews.Author: simead_orr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay for my husband for his 50th birthday and our 25th wedding anniversary and what a it turned out to be. I have already logged a review and I'm also in the middle of a de-bait with Hotelbeds regarding how this hotel can advertise a standard they cannot live up to. We had an awful experience with this "So called Hotel" it was truly awful. The smell of damp was awful and the room was dark and dingy. We asked to be moved and we got moved to a brighter room that was at the front of the building but very noisy as the window did not close properly. There was no shower curtain rail/curtain, the bath had chunks out of it, the bathroom cabinet had seen better days(ACTUALLY THERE WOULD HAVE BEEN BETTER CABINET'S IN THE LOCAL AMENITY CENTRE). PLEASE DO NOT BOOK THIS ACCOMMODATION AS IT WILL BE A TOTL WASTE OF YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU HAVE ANY STANDARDS PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: louisedudley
Reviews.Content: 1.Terrible smell of chip fat. 2.Rude staff completely unhelpful. 3.You have to beg for air con to be turned on continuously. 4.Mould in bath, although you could not use it as it was no bigger than a bidet. 5.Dirty toilet, taps and sink. 6.Dust everywhere. 7.Holes in walls and ceilings. 8.Nothing works: mini bar, hairdryer, safe. 9.Wires hanging out of the walls in corridors. 10.Hideous depressing decor. 10.DO NOT BELIEVE THE PHOTOGRAPHS, THEY MAKE IT LOOK PLEASANT.CLEARLY A GREAT DEAL OF ARTISTIC LICENSE IF YOU WANT YOUR HOLIDAY RUINED BOOK HERE, WE HAD TO BOOK AN EXTRA HOLIDAY WITHIN A HOLIDAY TO GET AWAY FROM THIS HOLE.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: claudia2074
Reviews.Content: Easy to find hotel with excellent transport links. From Rome Fiumiciono Airport to Rome Termini Station by train and from Rome Termini Station to the hotel by bus No. 40. The stop is on the front of the hotel. The staff is friendly and modest, the room had beautiful bedsheets and was clean throughout. Oana at the front desk was fantasic at advising tours, trips and booking transport. We have been in Capri one day tour. My room was just big enough for a double bed and ensuite, it was more than adequate for my four nights stay in Rome. Keep in mind that hotel rooms in Rome tend to be small anyways. If you have not been to Rome before you may be prepared for a culture shock if you are from the USA where everything is very much bigger!!! Breakfast was very basic, so don't raise your expectations. Toast and jams, cereals, a can of milk and one of orange juice. Same thing for the bathroom: small, but clean. My room was always tidied up and refreshed each day. Piazza Venezia Hotel is in a great location for sightseeing Rome. Also they are within walking distance of many famous landmarks: Colosseum, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, Phanteon... But again, the service is honest and decent.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers of Rome but worse!”
Reviews.Author: Starfish2201
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and it was comedy of errors! After booking a twin room we got two single - not so good when you have a 9 year old child. Finally got two rooms with co-join door. The architraves fell off the door. The fridge and the television didn't work in one room and the bathroom lights didn't work in the other room. Both bathrooms flooded - and I mean flooded- as the shower curtain was too small for the shower base and water went every where. The rooms were very small but that did not surprise me given the location. Breakfast was worse - sugared fruit drink rather juice, croissants stuffed with too much Nutella posed as pain au chocolat and the coffee and "hot" milk were in thermos - all in all disjusting. The only thing the hotel had going for it was the great location.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!!!DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RobertBernstein
Reviews.Content: Do not rely on those photos listed, that hotel may have looked like that at some point, but not anymore. Let me start our by saying the location is pretty good, about four blocks from the Colosseum, Pantheon and Treve fountain, however!!!! When we checked in they failed to mention that the room they gave us had no working air conditioning. When I called to ask they said it could be fixed in a few days or next month and there was no other room available for the night. The staff was extremely rude and unprofessional; the hotel was unclean, very unclean. So the following day they changed our room to another floor, which they said had working air conditioning, barely. I don't know which was worse, having no air with dirty carpets or a death trap for a bathroom that they switched us to. You could not easily sit down on the toilet without hitting the knob for the bad-aye and the tub was 2 feet tall to step into and was very unsafe standing up showering, not to mention the never ending noise from the street and corridors ALLLLLLL night, so forget about sleeping. Finally they fail to mention that they are not taking credit cards to pay for the stay and expect travelers to be able to take out 800 euros from an atm, yeah right! Just an overall bad hotel experience, spend the extra money on a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great place”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyM123
Reviews.Content: Our room felt like a little cabin. It was tiny and the ceiling slanted down making it feel even smaller. It didn't feel all that clean but fortunately this didn't cause a problem for us (bedbugs etc.). Luckily we spent almost all day out (and really avoided coming back to the room until we had to. If you stay here bring shower shoes. Really the only thing this place has going for it is the location, and in Rome that is SO important. It was so nice to wlak out of this place and be at any of the sites we wanted to within a 5-15 minute walk. The ruins are right down the street. The Pantheon is just a short walk in the other direction, as is the Trevi fountain. The Jewish campo, spanish steps, and more were all so close by! For Vatican City we just walked down to the Spanish steps, stopping at the other sights along the way and rode the metro from there just a few stops. Very convenient in that sense.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Accomodations and Service Imaginable”
Reviews.Author: Patti805
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here 2 nights. As I checked into my room, I felt like I couldn't breathe it was so small. I opened the window only to find a cement building in my face. It was raining - I felt trapped. The "wireless internet" eventually I was told I had to "go in the hallway" for, but I never got access. They didn't care AT ALL. The shower was 20"x 20 filled with mold which stuck to you as you showered. The toilet paper dispenser was so high up on the wall (I'm 5'7") I could barely reach it. What do others do??? The complimentary breakfast was a huge joke. No napkins, coco puffs, corn flakes, warm milk and s_it for pastries. Coffee not even filled in thermal pots - in Italy? Really? The stinly kindergarten "cafeteria seating" topped it off nicely. The upside? I was able to walk to all the sites I wanted to see in one day. It is a good location... if you dare.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Noisy, Depressing and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: GingerWChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: A family member booked this hotel and prepaid for it. When I read the reviews I became concerned but the money was nonrefundable. The room was worse than I imagined. The 1/2 bathtub wall was black with mold. There was no shower curtain and no drain cover so one had to crouch down in the 1/2 tub and try to spray oneself without getting any water on floor. Toilet was dirty. Room was claustrophically small. It had a sickening pervasive odor of roach spray. But if you opened the window to dissipate the smell, the traffic noise was unbearable. I have never complained about a hotel room to the management before but I complained to the apathetic woman at the desk, "The room is dirty, dark and disgusting. Could I get a better one?" She shrugged and said, "Oh no, they are all like that." By far the worst hotel I ever stayed in. Don't go near this abominable place.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AntonioZante
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel can offer is the spot and thats what you pay for. Rooms at least the ones they was given to us ,carpet and walls dirty as hell we had to walk side ways to go around the bed,very small even for a single bed ,no natural light no airconditioning. I guess rooms in any floor ( we stayed at 4th) with # 06 #8 #10 ,you will be very disappointed ( very small and overlooking dirty windows most propably never cleaned from Neros era.Staff no comments

Reviews.Title: “awfull!”
Reviews.Author: licuriciul
Reviews.Content: don't you ever go there! first day i arrived there was no electricity second day no hot water and the problem persisted until the 4th day breakfast was poor and no coffe at all the elevator wasn't working the room is dirty and small and the bath...awfull... and they say the hotel is 3 stars...

Reviews.Title: “Hostal like hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: OsloKrisa
Reviews.Content: The Piazza Venezia has one thing going for it, the location. It is perfectly situated on the Piazza Venezia, right in front of the Vittorio Emanuele monument. Some examples of normal walking distances: Piazza Navona: 10min, Pantheon: 5 min, Fontana di Trevi; 5 min, Colosseum: 7-8 min. There´s a direct bus to the Vatican City right outside the hotel entrance (line 40 takes about 10 min.- tickets can be bought at the tobacco shop in the same building as the hotel.) But if you´re also looking for somewhere to relax after a hard day´s walking around in the historical city of Rome look further. The room was tiny, the bathroom almost impossible to use. You have to travel with a partner to have someone hold the shower head while you shampoo and soap. The WC didn´t flush very well and it´s very crammed. The TV only has Italian channels and they´re all dubbed. Mind you, you will hear everything that´s going on in the surrounding rooms through the paper thin walls, so really you don´t need a TV. The hotel has a breakfast service for an additional €5, but we never tried it. The day receptionists arent of the forthcoming, service minded (smiling) types, but what can you expect for €60/night in low season inkl.city tax. The night shift receptionist, an elder man, turned out very friendly though. There is free WiFi internet on the 2nd floor. We had a 3rd floor room and the internet worked on and off in our room. All in all an ok experience for a few days, but only because of the location and all the amentities available at the hotel´s doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “We were shocked”
Reviews.Author: Annahubrob
Reviews.Content: We arrived and checked in, the lobby area is run down and alarm bells rang but we decided to go up to our room and hoped for the best. It was awful. The carpets were completely revolting, covered in stains from what looked like everything from drink to blood, the curtains were half hanging off and looked dirty, the bed covers looked filthy and there was a cold radiator with a broken leg against one wall. In fairness the cleaners probably had tried their best and the bathroom was clean but there is no way I would have wanted my bare feet to touch the carpet even if we had dared to sleep in the bed! We turned and walked out and checked in to another hotel across the piazza. Never stay there, it is disgusting. We have been offered and are waiting for a full refund from lastminute.com with whom we booked.

Reviews.Title: “If you thought the bad reviews were exaggerated -- reality is much worse!”
Reviews.Author: Alex2M
Reviews.Content: Brought one of our major Custoemrs with us, the hotel was booked by our travel agent. I was ashamed at the appalling quality of the hospitality here, whcih I would not tolerate at any price. The fact that the location is great does not justify staying here, there are other hotels nearby at similar prices which aer much cleaner and well appointed. I am not going to go on for much longer, I only stayed 2 nights and many people have described in detail the shortfalls of the place. In a word, never again, but just a few examples: - Room 1 without windows, but with toilet still dirty from previous occupant. Bathroom litter showed eitehr no inspection after cleaning, or no cleaning. The (very nice) night porter gives me a single room (marginally cleaner) and plenty of apologies. - Room 2, is single. Very single, a size 10 shoebox would be more spacious. Bathroom cleaner than the previous. Window opening on street, noisy all night (Irish Rugby tourists ...) - Awaken at 8am by hotel manager shouting at cleaner becasue "many customers had complained about dirty bathrooms". Row happening in front of my door ... by design? - Moved again to Room 1 which should now be clean. It isn't. Night porter embarrassed. I'm too tired to argue, - Breakfast (the day before there was nothing left). Wifi does not work. Coffee cold and watery. Not much to eat, either. I bring customers for breakfast to bar downstairs (Il Castelletto) pricey but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of our entire trip- what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_from_Adelaide_OZ
Reviews.Content: It seems that the only rooms in this hotel worth staying in are on the second floor. Our 4th floor room was dirty, cramped and the window not closeable, having apparently been forced open before. The room we had faced a laneway where late night revellers park their scooters and drink and smash bottles in the early hours, so not being able to close the window finished any idea of sleep. The receptionist was next to useless, rude and unhelpful, talking on the phone to friends while we waited. The safe in the room did not work when we arrived and despite 2 requests to have it fixed, "the maintenance man was not available". Even tried to add 10 euros to the fixed 40E taxi fair to the airport, and when I pointed this out she pointed to the street and said try there. The breakfast is virtually non-existent and the whole hotel a great disappointment. The place is a rat hole and a dump. There are plenty of better places to stay in Rome. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: qtpinoy54
Reviews.Content: I admit, I was initially uneasy about staying at this hotel after the numerous negative comments. My partner and I have traveled quite a bit and had our share of pretty bad and good hotel rooms. This is definitely not a 4-5 star hotel, but doesn't claim to be one. The hotel is right in front of the hustle and bustle of Piazza Venezia and within spitting distance of The VIttoriano. We took a cab from FCO and cost us about 60 Euros. From the hotel, everything is within walking distance. The Trevi Fountain is a 5 minute walk, as well as the Roman Forum and 10 minutes to the Colosseum and Piazza Navona and Pantheon. Bus line 64 stops right in front of the hotel to go to the Vatican and the Termini. The bus ride to the vatican was about 10 minutes without traffic. The lobby is somewhat simple and small with just one desk. Not the usual long counters at other big hotels. The hotel lobby and hallways are well lit and beautifully decorated with pop art. The elevator was all glass and very unique. The room we stayed at 204 was simple yet functional. It's not big, but not small either. We stayed at smaller hotels in Tokyo so room size was not an issue for us. Room and bathroom was clean. Sheets were clean as well. High ceilings actually made the room look bigger. It had a huge window overlooking the Piazza which we liked. If you're sensitive to outside noise, then you should probably get some earplugs as it can get loud during the daytime. The noise didn't bother us though. The bed was firm but comfortable. There was a small flat screen TV in the room but we didn't find any English channels, only Italian. The bathtub/shower does not have shower curtains, so you would have to sit on the tub if you want to shower to avoid water getting on the floor. It was fine with us although this might be an issue with tall people. The toilet was pretty narrow so this might be an issue with wider folks. There is a built in semi-bidet on the toilet bowl which was nice. Also, the towels are not the usual plush towels but they did the job. Amenities were good, they gave us shampoo, soap, etc. There is a room safe as well and a small fridge. We didn't bother with the mini bar because the drinks were 3.50 Euros each. The walls in the room I can tell were kind of thin as we could hear people talking outside the room, but that didn't bother us. WIFI signal was pretty spotty inside the room, but was very strong in the hallways. I was able to facetime my family back home using my iphone with very little lag. They have chairs and tables right outside the room. Don't forget to leave the maid 2 Euros if you want your room made up. Breakfast was not included with our reservation, but we usually leave the hotel before 7AM anyway to beat the crowd at the tourist attractions so we always ate outside. There's also a DESPAR supermarket 5 minutes away from the hotel where we bought food and drinks. We did try the hotel breakfast for 5 Euros a person. The breakfast was simple yet satisfying. It was just a usual continental breakfast and consisted of coffee/tea/juice and Italian pastries. I thought it was a good deal for 5 Euros since you can easily spend almost 4 Euros for a cup of coffee outside. Overall, I really liked this hotel. It's basic but it really did the job for us and the location cannot be beat! If you're a low maintenance traveler on a budget looking for a basic hotel, then I would suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: OttawaJack
Reviews.Content: My partner and I read reviews about this hotel prior to booking two nights in October. One review stated that a room upgrade was essential so we booked a superior room. The location is convenient although the hotel is somewhat difficult to find - - it is only identifiable by a small plaque next to the door. Our room was tiny and did not have a window. We reported that the bathroom sink was clogged and when we returned from an outing, we found muddy footprints and a dirty, bloody rag on the bathroom floor. We asked the front desk receptionist why our room was considered "superior" and she told us that we'd have to talk to her colleague. When we finally had an opportunity to speak to this individual, we were told that because there were no superior rooms available when we checked in, we got a free breakfast included instead. The "breakfast" included coffee and one of three lonely danishes. On the flip side, we were told that the room cost "about" $30 Euro more per night. Hardly a fair trade. My partner and I have both travelled extensively and agree that this was, by far, the worst hotel experience either of us have had.

Reviews.Title: “Top location - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Dkenny_uk
Reviews.Content: Lot of bad reviews about this hotel and mainly seem to be about rooms on the 4th floor and the staff. My partner and I stayed here for three nights in October and it was fine. It ain't no Ritz but it's Ok. It's clean enough, staff were friendly enough and our 3rd floor room was ok. It was a few steps up from a good hostel but did the job. Clean, tv, fridge, good shower, hairdryer, etc. Very basic and really poor view but we used it to change and sleep so was fine. 5 mins from Trevi, 8 mins from Colloseum, 8 mins from Pantheon, bus 40 outside to Vatican , 8 mins from 2 metros. All in all for less than €100 a night in central Rome, couldn't do better. Great for a "cheap" weekend in Rome or base for lads only break. Don't use it fir family or romantic break but for a budget but top location, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, disgusting rooms.”
Reviews.Author: GuyPearson
Reviews.Content: There is only one positive thing to say about this hotel and that is its very central location. The photos on the hotel website are very misleading. They have obviously taken pictures of selected rooms when they were newly decorated. We had a room on the 4th floor and so did some other friends. The room was tiny; carpets were disgustingly filthy, grimy even; the walls were filthy and stained; the room was really dark even with lights on; it was unbearably hot in the room all the time but if you opened the window it was really noisy; the light in the bathroom was dangerous and blinding. My husband managed one hot shower, the rest of the time the water was freezing cold, I couldn't have a shower at all in 4 days! We did complain about this but nothing was done, they didn't seem to be interested. Our friends didn't even have a window in their room. Our other friends had a room on the 2nd floor which seemed better, not as dirty and not so hot, so if you do go to this hotel, because of the location, steer clear of the 4th floor. I am not a cleanliness freak or anything and have never written a review before, but please don't be disappointed, look carefully elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location but no frills, cramped "lobby", unconcerned staff, and punk rock art on lobby wall,”
Reviews.Author: GaryMac48
Reviews.Content: First, this is absolutely the best location in Rome. Right in front of the Piazza Venezia, central to everything. That's the great part - nothing else is. The hotel is offbeat and bizarre. I arrived hours before my room was ready, so I asked them to hold on to my luggage - they showed me the "closet" to put it in - small and mostly packed with other suitcases. But there was no lock on the door, and in these cramped close quarters (stairway to upstairs goes right by the closet) anybody could grab anything! As I put my stuff in, the clerk eyed my netbook case and asked if there was a laptop in there - when I said yes, she said she'd better keep an eye on it herself and put it behind the hotel desk - just a bit unsettling and during the few hours I walked around waiting for my room, believe me I thought about it. It was there when I got back, but my room was the tiniest I have ever stayed in - not counting the bathroom (which was "basic" but OK), it was roughly 10 ft x 7 ft. The bed was positioned along the side wall (10 ft wall) otherwise you would have to squeeze to get past the bed. Counted in that 10 feet at one end, is the rod that is suspended between 2 boards to hang your clothes on (no doors covering it). The (one) window was high up and you have to step up a foot or more to see out. TV was likewise tiny - fridge was warmish - lucky only bottles are in there, because perishibles would not make it thru the night. Furniture was like Salvation Army (no offense meant). The lobby help (looked like all in 20's) was "detached" - unconcerned no matter what the issue was - you got the feeling that if you brought up a problem you were being a bit pesky. They were like a clique and seemed to be having a good time with each other (and avoided eye contact with the pesky guests as much as possible)- strangely none of them were Italian, even the floorsweeper (no carpet in lobby) - they all spoke another foreign language to each other, and I wondered how this all came about... The lobby has rock and roll "art' on the walls - I honestly could not tell if it was intentional or if someone had snuck in and scrawled graffiti all over and pasted up some homemade posters someone had thrown away- plus a picture of a semi-undressed dude. I later asked for an adjustment in my bill due to an air conditioning malfunction, and the answer was "you pre-paid (internet) so there's nothing we can do here - write a letter to the manager". I asked where he was - "Not here". I later wrote a letter - no response. At 1 AM one morning I could hear talking outside my room, (3rd floor) and it kept up for 15 munutes or more, so I got up and took a peek out (no peep holes in doors) to see what jerks would hang around the hallways at that hour - someone had put a small table in the narrow hall with 2 chairs and there was a guy talking on his cell phone! Well you get the picture - if you just want a bed in a great location for low cost, can sleep like a rock , and don't care about your offbeat cramped surroundings, this is fine (but so is a hostel and a lot friendlier). But if you or your spouse/partner/friend like a decent room, amenities, quiet accomodations, normal people running the hotel and respectability, don't stay here! But do walk in just to check out the lobby as I described it - Don't worry no one will ask what you want !

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LAHLB
Reviews.Content: This place was a filthy dump! Everything was dirty! My room had a window to the elevator shaft. The room was so hot that I couldn't sleep and the air conditioner didn't work! The carpets were filthy! The staff was pleasant but not very helpful or professional. The employees talked in front of me without stopping to see what I needed or wanted. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful is an understatment”
Reviews.Author: smilingrl36
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was nothing short of awful. The receptionist was one of the rudest and most uncooperative out of all the hotels I have stayed in. This coming from a born and raised New Yorker I have met many rude people in my time and have came across many people who do not do their job properly and she was the top of the list. On arrival, we were conversing with her in Italian and she was very put off by questions we asked and acted like she did not want to be there. The staff told us our room was on the third floor and that it was not the room that we had booked but would be able to change rooms the next morning. We arrive in a room that we did not want to find a small window and a bathroom that was unusable. Please explain to me how you are supposed to get ready when the shower floods the bathroom and when you turn on the sink water comes spilling out the bottom of the base ? Let's just say our bathroom was flooded within one use of the sink or shower. We sucked it up and spent the night in that room. The next morning we were able to switch rooms according to the staff. When I called reception at 11am explaining what was told to me the day before I was told this was impossible and no rooms are open. I felt like something was not right so went down and spoke with her in whom she claimed she did not understand (which she did since we explained in English and Italian). We went out for the day and came back and demanded a room change to what we booked (a room with 2 beds) she said nothing is open then magically pulled a key out for a new room. We proceed to the new room and holy crap it was worse than the first room. The carpet was filthy and the room was located on the 4th floor with little light and a musty smell. We figured to give this new room a shot and spent the night in the room to find the bathroom door doesn't shut and the A/C is broken. It is August in Rome and anyone who has been knows it is HOT as HELL! Sleep was minimal and it was unbearable in the room. The next day I found myself sick with no voice and 2 bloody noses (which i have never had in my lifetime) The room was so stuffy and with no air. We went downstairs and complained and the staff informed us there was nothing they can do and there are no rooms. I was so upset and did not understand how an entire hotel in which we never saw a soul was full. We were forced to stay in the unbearable heat for another 2 nights until we checked out. It was miserable and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I don’t think it is worth even the 3 stars that it is given. This was the last stop on my 2 week backpacking trip around Europe and I must say Hostels are cleaner, have friendlier staff and A/C that works. I would recommend staying in a hostel over this hotel with its rude staff and dirty floors and small windows. Location was great at this hotel but that is where the positives end.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: SwiftyWalsall
Reviews.Content: Reception Staff very helpful to us as first time visitors room clean and well appointed and laundry services and cleaning done every day faultlessly.Everything worked well including air con and electricals. We were on 3rd floor- we had no noise from street or other guests and window faced onto Piazza- standard double. I had read some poor reviews and was very relieved when I saw our room and we had a very good stay- give it a go cos its a really nice place to stay and very handy. One point is that its hard to see the hotel nameplate as its a bit modest and we nearly walked past it when we first arrived

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service but great location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer_NW_London
Reviews.Content: I don't normally leave comments on hotels but after our service here on arrival I feel compelled to warn others. We have just arrived home after staying at this hotel. We arrived and were not even greeted by the rudest receptionist I have ever met. I am 27 - I have met a lot of rude people in my life but she was definitely in the top ten. She barely grunted when I said we had a reservation and only spoke to ask for our passports and then tell us the room number. (She could speak English as we unfortunately had to converse with her for longer later on). We were given the most dog awful room on the 4th floor. If you are given a 4th floor room - refuse it straight away - they are shocking. Our 1st room had no air conditioning and no window - it was 40 degrees outside! No window and was in a loft - my boyfriend couldn't stand in the vast majority of the room. The bathroom was disgusting. We paid £360 for 5 nights while this is good for Rome this was still a fair amount and after cheaper and nicer hotel rooms the previous nights of our holiday in Venice and Naples this room made me want to cry. We went back downstairs with all of our luggage to complain and was told that this was the only double room in the hotel. The rooms of the 3rd floor were out of action as there was a problem with the AC. We could stay in this room or in two single rooms until the next night when they would have a double free. We had booked a double room with AC at least a month prior to going. I said I wasn't having that room and would rather stay in the singles. We were then given a triple room again on the 4th floor. Again no AC and the window in the room was a sky light covered with about 10 years worth of moss. We went back down the stairs again with all of our luggage and complained. This time we were given a double room on the 2nd floor with AC (and a window). Why were we told that there wasn't any double rooms available with AC when there was?! We were obviously really annoyed - the receptionist never apologised and was clearly inconvenienced with our complaints. Other then the problems on the 1st day, the hotel was great. The other hotel staff were pleasant. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom is small but perfectly adequate. The location is awesome - you can walk every where and is a few mins from the Collesium, Forum, Trevi Fountain etc. Be warned, the walls are super thin and we were woken every night by noise next door and in the hallway. The cleaners also start work extremely early and are banging away in the hallway from about 7 am onwards - no chance of a lie in here. The phone in the corridor also seemed to ring every 3 mins from 7am onwards and was insanely loud. I am not too sure if I would recommend this hotel - while were had a nice stay in the end, I wouldn't want to risk being stuck on that 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bad hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Terrier5266
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we've felt compelled to write a review about any hotel because of the miserable conditions and dispicable accomodations. This hotel had a multitude of things that were wrong with it. Here is a short list of the problems: 1: The doors to both of our rooms took a few minutes to open each time because the electronic locks malfunctioned. 2: The bathroom door did not open all the way because it would get stuck on the floor tile, forcing you to squeeze through the doorway to get into the bathroom. 3: The bathroom was approximately 4 feet by 5 feet in size. 4: The problems with the bathroom were the following: 4a: Ceiling had chipped and missing paint around light fixture. 4b: The faucet and drain had lost all of their shiny coating. 4c: The bulbs above the mirror were all different shapes & sizes. 4d: The bathtub had chipped enamel, old fixtures, high sides, was approx. 2'x3', and had no shower curtain (forcing you to make a puddle on the very slippery tile) 4e: The toilet was a combination bidet/toilet. 4f: The handle to the bidet was directly at thigh height while sitting at the toilet, causing the bidet to automoatically turn on as you sat on the toilet. 4g: The bathroom was so small that there was not even enough room for the toilet paper holder to be mounted at normal height and was located approximately 6 feet high on the wall. 4h: The "bathtub" was angled in such a way that the only place you could stand without slipping was on top of the drain. 4i: The drains appeared clogged which resulted in the water taking a long time to drain. 5: The floor had a quarter of an inch layer of dirt all over it and especially around the edges. 6: The wallpaper was peeling off the walls. 7: The painted walls had numerous scuff marks and were dirty. 8: There was a lack of standard hotel room furnishings (dresser, closet doors, etc). 9: The safe was located INSIDE the refridgerator (just incase the money was feeling hot) 10:The linens were "crusty" in spots. 11:The window was about 5 feet off the floor. 12:The rooms were supposedly adjoining yet the doorway had been sealed. 13:The decorations in the hallways looked like they had been made by a crazed 5 yr old. 14:It was extremely loud outside all night and at points the front gate had to be locked by the "concierge" due to fights occurring outside at the all-night bars. This hotel most definately did not deserve 3 Stars. We were seriously considering scratching off a few stars from the front door as we departed.

Reviews.Title: “catastrofic place”
Reviews.Author: jerem25
Reviews.Content: I' been staying in Hotel plazza venezia during one week end. It was a catastrofic place. Indeed the room was not lightfull at all. I even would say it looks like in jail because windows were very small and unaccessible. The bathroom was so small and not very clean. During my reservation, i requested a triple bedroom, but it was not available at all. In this hotel, its quite impossible to take some rest, as the housekeeper knocked our door very early on sunday morning. Last, but not least, the hotel wanted me to pay by cash not by credit card ! At least if the hotel was cheap, i wouldn't complain but it was so expensive (160 € a night) that it's not worth it at all

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very bad service”
Reviews.Author: khanno
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 18-22 June 2010 through booking made by lastminute.com. I did check on hotel reviews on trip advisor and must say I too had mix feelings staying at this hotel. All comments about poor service is true! Don't be fooled by the pics provided by the hotel. I didn't find reception to be helpful because they don't speak english or refuse to speak it and secondly one young lady at reception made us wait for 20 mins when we arrived as she kept answering phones. I found that very rude. Our fridge never worked even tho we asked for 3 days for it be fixed but never got looked in to. The air con is provided on request as you cannot control it from your room. You have to ask the reception. The rooms are really, really small so imagine the bathroom. The rooms were clean and we got clean towels everyday, however the touch of the towels are like tea towels but only bigger. The only good thing is the location. The bus we took from the roma termini train station number 40 or 64 drops you right infront of the hotel and you can catch all the buses from there to go to the vatican, colosseum etc. You only pay one euro which is reasonable.The Roma termini train station is only about 1 mile away from the hotel. The train from the airport to the city cost 14 euro one way. Beware this hotel is on the main road in the city square so plenty of traffice noise and sirens.

Reviews.Title: “So delicious”
Reviews.Author: rendysainz77
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and a very good location. Really walking distance to the main places The staff was very helpfull and the service was excellent. Our room was facing Venezia square, decent size and conveniently furnished.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: deebenz
Reviews.Content: Two other friends and myself stayed at this hotel for four nights in late May. This hotel is so centrally located, it's unbelievable. To the left of the hotel lies the Roman Forum, or ancient ruins, as well as the Colosseum. To the right is lively Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona and the Vatican. Directly behind the hotel you will find the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Awesome! Right next door to the hotel is an amazing gelateria where I ate gelato every single day. For 2,50 euro you get two different gelato flavors and they decorate your cone with cute waffle pieces and candy. Yum! Definitely try it. As for the hotel itself, we really enjoyed it. Our room was on the top level and was surrounded by cute breakfast tables where guests would eat in the morning. The room was more modern and the beds were VERY comfortable. The bathroom was also very nice, however no shower curtains (as was the case throughout all of Europe). With regard to cleanliness, the room was very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel. One thing I did not like was that air conditioning was controlled by the receptionist. When turned on, our room would be freezing. When off, we would sweat as Rome is very hot in the summer. The hotel staff, however, were sketch. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by a kind young woman who was very helpful and pointed out several locations on a map for us to visit. Throughout the remainder of our stay, the staff seemed to get annoyed with our questions. When we requested a cab back to the airport in advance, we were told no cabs would be available at that time (5pm) and we had to pay extra for a private driver. Our next destination was to the Greek Islands and we had asked the receptionist to call our hotel for us in Greece as our room phone was broken. She refused and quickly became very annoyed with us. Other than her attitude, our experience at this hotel was phenomenal. LASTLY - DO visit the restaurant called La Carbonara. Do not confuse this restaurant with the touristy La Carbonara located in Campo de Fiori. The restaurant I am referring to is located in a very non-touristy area off of a quiet street in Monti. It is family-owned and operated. Mama Teresa walks around and prepares all of her homemade dishes. SO SO good. We had dinner one night, and went back for lunch the next day!

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: mariaBrazil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really dirty!!!!!! the rooms are not renovated, bad smell. it seems that there was a good interior designer project, but they didin't keep it, and it is very disgusting. We tried to leave the hotel, but how we had paid it before the travel, the manager changed us to the best room that they had, but guess what? it was dirty too! but very better than the standart rooms. In other way, the location is very good, near de attractions, that Rome has a lot, we didin't need to take a bus ore subway. There are a lot of bars near the hotel , and you can eat a soup, ore snacks at afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not luxury accommodation but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: redcurrantSheffield
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beaten. Five minutes away from the Musei Capitoline and major archeological sites. Major bus routes and bus tours in the Piazza Venezia on your doorstep. Pantheon and Piazza Navona both a stroll away and just round the corner from the shops on Via del Corso. Bedroom was comfortable and clean - took the advice of a previous review and took a travel kettle, although a voucher for continental breakfast is available from the front desk for 5 euros (coffee from a machine). The room was noisy at night (mostly traffic from the main street below) but ear plugs did the trick. Bathroom was small and cramped and could do with refurbishment but that's my only criticism (that's why I've marked the room 3 out of 5). We were originally given a room at the back of the hotel (Room 238) which was small and next to a toilet which doubled as access to a balcony used by smokers. Would recommend you request another room if you're allocated this one - our sleep was distrubed by people accessing the balcony and the room smelled of stale tobacco. We moved to another room the next day which was much better. The front desk was happy to accommodate our request for a room change. If you are getting a taxi to the airport for your return journey, don't bother ordering one from the hotel as they charge you 10euros. There is a taxi rank on the Piazza which is two minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location cant be beaten, expensive though”
Reviews.Author: brionnotbrian
Reviews.Content: Great location but is pricey. However when compared to other hotels in Rome it is good value. Room was very small and air con wasnt the best but when in Rome there is no need to spend time in the hotel...so much to see and do

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break with Grandson over Easter”
Reviews.Author: santapaws
Reviews.Content: For the $$$$ and the Location would stay again as it was typical of many European hotels that are for the budget minded. Our room was on the street which had noise but didn't bother us as we were exhausted at nite. The front desk was hospitable and answered any questions that we had. The room and bath were tiny,No shortage of hot water and the towels were different, tight woven cotton like a table napkin but very effective.The location was VERY good with bus connections right at the front door and a 24 hour bakery coffee shop next door. The room was clean and we had no problems with location or noise, but were amazed at how many people came to the monument at all hours. Would recommend it for a safe place to sleep and save some Euros. The only thing we would have liked was CNN to keep up with the news but had a comfortable six nite stay and if you'e use to being a tourist in europe you will not have any major problems with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schlong
Reviews.Content: If your looing for Italian luxury then this isn't the hotel for you, however, if you are looking for somewhere which is very close to all the major sites and is just somewhere you can use as a base then this is ideal. The rooms are very small but ours was decorated quite modern though and there is a problem with accoustics with this hotel, you can occaisionally hear people in their rooms which actually sounds like they are standing outside your door but to be honest you will be so tired of walking all around the attractions that you wont know as sooon as your head hits the pillow! Do not use the restuarants next to the hotel as they are a total rip-off, they charge £5 for a glass of coke or coffee where round the corner it is only £1, and the food is crap. We found a hair in our pizza and when we showed them they just took it off us and just left us there to pay, so avoid. Reccomend paying a bit extra for a guided tour of the colesem, you skip the big que and get some some interesting information. If not you can always use one of those head phone things that talks you through. Don't go to the Vatican museums and St Peters Basilica on the same day, you will be too tired to go to the Basilica afterwards. We went to the Basilica on Sunday (amazing building) not realizing the vatican is closed on a sunday which turned out to be a good thing as when we came out of the vatican on the following day we were glad we didn't have to do the Basilica. Don't do the guided tour of the Vatican musems either, they will charge you £25 plus the entrance fee of £15 (£8 if you are a student). You can hire the radio guides for £7 which are just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lauren29
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, and as a base for exploring Rome, this hotel was excellent. It is spotlessly clean, with comfortable beds and a good bathroom. Some of the reviews on this site state that the rooms are tiny, but the building is over 400 years old so, you know, you have to work with what you got! Our room was a totally normal height. It was so centrally located, bang in the centre of everything. Capitoline Hill was across the road, and two of what I believe are the city's best restaurants are tucked around the back. Other attractions such as the Collosseum and the Trevi Fountain are very nearby, while the Spanish Steps and the Piazza Navone make for a nice walk a bit further away. Vatican City is a short, very cheap cab ride away but could be just as easily reached by bus. The receptionists were all really helpful and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoyeP
Reviews.Content: Very well located, clean hotel one block north of the Piazza Venezia. They don't allow you to check in before 2pm. The rooms were neat and not too small (maybe 18ft squared). The street noise outside was very loud, but I slept with earplugs and had no problem. The shower was basically a tiny 2-foot-square tile area with a curtain around it. Definitely no-frills. The whole bathroom got wet when I took a shower. But for a budget hotel, it's very well positioned in the heart of Rome and was just fine! I'd stay there again and recommend it - as long as you bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: leftwingback
Reviews.Content: how this can be rated as a 3 star is beyond me, or did i just get given the crappiest room in the hotel? it definitely did not match the photos shown. Our top floor room was nothing special, but not especially bad either. temperate control was non-existent though, which made for 2 uncomfortable nights of sleep. but what really deserves a mention was the bathroom. it was small and old (and the wash basin was cracked), definitely below the standards of a 3 star hotel. what's more, the shower square was right next to the toilet, and they're separated by a shower curtain (yes a shower curtain, and a dirty one too, with a fair bit of soap scum at the bottom of it). so when we took a shower, the bathroom got a bit flooded and the floor was pretty disgusting. had i known this was going to be the case i wouldn't have booked it in a million years. The only positive is that the hotel is in a great location - sites like the colloseum, the pantheon, trevi fountain and the spanish steps are all within walking distance, and there are bus stops right outside the hotel for vatican city and termini station.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should have its three stars removed – preferably with an axe”
Reviews.Author: jatrichardson
Reviews.Content: Our room was APPALLING: There was no window in the room, which was under the eaves. A skylight in the lobby was covered by a blind that fell on my head - metal casing and all - and was dangerous. The bed was tucked under the eaves, giving very limited headroom and I bumped my head many times. The power-point for the television was broken and there was no remote control (the janitor did fix these two items). The sole provision for hanging/storing clothes was a rail above the mini-bar (more later), which was too short and fell down whenever you tried to hang things from it. The mini bar itself was broken and its wiring was in a dangerous condition - a complaint that the staff met with a shrug. This meant that there was nowhere to keep things cool. There was no provision for tea or coffee-making facilities in the room. The bathroom had an unprotected power point with a cover missing – in a wet-room environment. DANGEROUS. The shower head was too low to get underneath. The bathroom lights were, er, eccentrically wired in that there were THREE switches in serial which had ALL to be on for the lights to work. The room was also noisy; you could hear everything happening in the corridor at all hours of the day and night. We run a small B&B in the UK – where we charge less than half what Piazza Venezia charge, and offer AT LEAST twice the facility. We do know how it should be. This hotel should have its three stars removed – preferably with an axe. On the plus side, it was always clean and cleaned; the bed was comfortable and the bed, bed-head and lights were of a good quality. Towels were changed daily (they had to be as there was no ventilation in the bathroom). The positioning was PERFECT – right in the middle of the City; we could and did walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “oh my god”
Reviews.Author: noonedog1986
Reviews.Content: (oh my god) what a hotel his was the room was as small as a match box and the bathroom was also, every time we asked the staff they didnt have a clue about anything because they couldnt understand me or my girlfriend and what ever you do dont use the lift its a death trap and dont believe the pictures you see on here trust me because not all rooms are like that as shown on here but otherwise the location is great thats the only thing goin for this hotel i think myself

Reviews.Title: “The best location!”
Reviews.Author: nvh100
Reviews.Content: I had a love hate relationship with this place. There was no air con in our room, which was unbearable. Also on the first night my husband and I both showered and found out that the bathrooms completely flood. Even to the point of water stretching right across the room. We spent a good deal of time soaking up water with towels. They gave us a fan for the first night and then moved us the night after so we had air con for the rest of the stay. However this is not controlled per room, so if its too cold you have to lump it. Again in the next room the bathroom flooded. Anyway doen with all the negatives, the location was awesome, right by one of the most beautiful monuments Palazzo Venezia and right by the roman forum. The location of this hotel could not be beaten at such a low price. If you can put up with a few negatives this hotel can make Rome even more accessible. I enjoyed my stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if...”
Reviews.Author: BBSW
Reviews.Content: ...you opt for the superior deluxe rooms. The standard rooms are absolute rubbish. We paid an extra 30 Euro per night to upgrade and it was well worth it. The location is unbeatable, most of the main attractions are within 10 mins walk, the Vatican City and Train Station are about 10 mins by bus which stops right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overpay”
Reviews.Author: EricArthurBlair
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Rome with no hotel reservation and I wasn't able to find any hotel with rooms available, so, first I was pleased to find this for 150 euros per night. The cab driver had trouble to find the hotel, so I would recommend to look the doors between the 3 cafe's, one of them called Brasil Cafe. First night, they gave us a terrible room, on top floor, with no window, just a weird roof window, that I wasn't able to close and so I wasn't able to sleep because of the annoying street noise. The bathroom was disguting, it seemed that it has not been clean after the another guest checked out, and it was impossible to not wet all bathroom floor, as the shower was not working. Then, I've asked to change room and the deskman was really rude. So rude I decided to not stay there anymore, but as the check out time was gone, I had to stay another night. After all, he gave us another room, really better than the other, and the double window was amazing, no sound from the street. Despite the second room, it was not worthy the price I've payed for it, specially because of the first night and the rudeness deskman I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by others reviews”
Reviews.Author: MISSLUVIAN
Reviews.Content: Because i booked this hotel as a myster hotel on latsminute and when i found out id booked hotel piazza venezia.I groaned withd issapointment and panicked when i read the reviews below. So heres a tip: the hotel door is situated between ttwo cafes. there is a sign. Dont go expecting a massive doorway. Luckily by cab driver pointed it out or i could have got lost in the bustle of the street and missed it too. Friendly helpful staff, small but clean and modern reception. The room was clean and the view looked out at Piazza Venezia so was very happy about that! So it wasnt The Ritz, but I hadnt paid for a super swanky hotel. It did what i wanted - a rom to sleep and shower in. A more expensive room wouldhave been wasteful because I was out exploring the city! And I need not go far. The Collesium,. the forum and ruins, the trevi fountain...its on your doorstep. The location, for the price you pay, is worth it for that alone. I did have only one issue -one being there was a bidet type flush handle on the wall which you had to lean over so you didnt push it and get a wet bum before you were finished! the toiet was slightly cramped and i could see larger or older people having anissue with that. The shower was hot and worked. teh bed was comfy. the mini bar was stocked. rome was on our doorstep. the staff were more than happy to help. iall in all, a very pleasnt experience

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel to lounge around in...”
