Reviews.Author: Tracie58712
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome for the Marathon in March 2009. I found and booked this hotel after price comparing and reading reviews on here and elsewhere. The hotel is/was fairly difficult to find the first time. It's tucked between a couple cafes and you can walk right past it very easily... as we did the first time. The hotel is pretty much bare bones and the photos on its website are NOT representative of what the rooms truly look like. There is a reception desk, elevator, room with a TEENY, TINY bathroom and shower (more about this later) and bed so close to the wall that my husband had to walk sideways to get from his side of the bed over to the bathroom, and that's about it. But really, when you're in Rome, you're not really going to spend all that much time in your room, so it was okay for us. The bathroom, in particular, the shower. Oh my gosh. For the Americans out there, think of your bathtub at home... long and fairly wide. Now, think of splitting that into thirds lengthwise and one of those thirds is the shower at this hotel. There's no shower curtain, and you can't hang the shower head up, lest get water all over the vanity, so you'd literally have to squat down, get yourself wet, stand up and soap up, and squat back down to rinse off. I have to say, it was the worst shower I've ever taken, and I had to do it three days in a row. And if you wanted to take a bath (say, after a marathon), there was no way for it to happen... the tub is just way, way too short. No thanks!! The pros of the hotel are of course its location. You're so close to a lot of the sites and it's really in a prime place. If you're looking for a hotel to just chill in your room (and why would you do this in Rome?!), this hotel is not for you. If you want to get out and explore, as long as you can overlook the shower issue, this hotel might be right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but.......”
Reviews.Author: Clo9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Piazza Venezia for one night. The hotel wasn't the easiest to find, we were at least expecting a sign on the outside. It is small, cramped & the toilet had a very distinctive aroma! On the plus side, the location is excellent.The colleseum is very close,as well as all the other attraction. The large selection of bars/restaurants in the area made up for the lack of facilites in the hotel. Over all, it's an OK hotel provided you are out & about all day & not looking for any of the usual hotel facilites, i.e. bar/restaurant etc. Location is great though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Practical”
Reviews.Author: NJGMP
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day visit to Rome. My wife and I were looking for a reasonably priced hotel near the center of Rome. The hotel is small and basic but served its purpose for two people who wanted to have a clean room, private bath, and a central point to see the sites of Rome. There are definitely no frills with this hotel. Our room was very small (but clean) and the bathroom could have been a bit more comfortable. However, if your main goal in getting a hotel is simply to have a place to sleep after touring Rome all day, this place was definitely adequate. The hotel is located right next to the Piazza Venezia and situtated at the beginning of the Via del Corso (one of Rome's main shopping districts). The best way to describe this hotel would be to call it "practical".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_s_
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in terrific location, walking distance to everything.... Rooms were as seen on hotel website, staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location thats all”
Reviews.Author: jimann99
Reviews.Content: arrived 8/10/08 for 4 nights it was 23 degrees out side. we were given a room on the 4th flour this room was in an attic with no natural light comming into the room only a 2 foot square sky light leading up a shoot onto the roof.after a sleepless night we asked too be moved which we were too the 3rd floor the staff were very helpfull.this room was much better it had a window leading out onto the plaza venezzia wich is a 24hr plaza the noise was unreal and when we closed the window the heat in the room was unbearable you just had too leave the window open for some air so we got little or no sleep for the 4 nights. the bathroom was a joke i had too put one foot in the bath too sit on the toilet bowl .iwill say do the room was spotless and bathroom ,i would not return tuu this hotel again or recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Utter waste of time”
Reviews.Author: jdportland
Reviews.Content: Do NOT expect what you see in picture on the web. NOTHING in this hotel was functioning properly: no air conditiioning, no elevator, no functional television, barely functional plumbing! Extremely small rooms, many with no windows. It is clean and the staff are nice, but of course they don't have to stay in the rooms. Altogether a huge waste of money, will never return.

Reviews.Title: “do not expect what you see on the web”
Reviews.Author: FreddieYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The reception area was scruffy. The room was miniscule, dark and gloomy. The washbasin was cracked and taps dripped. The shower was over a hip bath and the shower head fell off the moment water was turned on or off. The loo dripped all night long. Bathroom was so small and cramped you could not move. Air conditioning was non existant. The photos on the web do not represent anything I saw! Bedding was clean , staff were friendly and helpful but no way would I stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aly_Cola
Reviews.Content: My bestfriend & I traveled through Europe for a month in June of 08. We were in Florence & booked this hotel at the very last minute. We thought we were going to get a total dump but it turned out to be one of the best hotels of our trip. It was clean not spick and span but definitely clean. You absolutely can't beat the location. We walked everywhere. You can literally walk to every single sight except the Vatican which was a very short bus ride. There was a TV in the room that actually worked. The bathroom did have a kinda funky scent to it but only the bathroom not the room. Just a musky smell. The hotel however was in the perfect location with a great price! I would highly recommend it to anyone. It's no romantic hideaway but definitely a great hotel for those traveling through Europe. We were 2 girls from O.C. and we were just fine there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Service & Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: JeanSol9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and the room was an ok size. Other than that, the hotel service and accommodations were very bad. We were there for 5 nights. On one day, the phone did not work. Another day, we had no hot water. On another day, the airconditioner did not work. Basically, something was always breaking down and the response we would get is that the technician had already been a called about it. Things were not repaired as quickly as desired, meaning that we had to place several phone calls to get things fixed. At the end, no apologies or no discounts. If what you are looking for is a good location only, this is an ok hotel to stay at. Otherwise, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: babygLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic four days trip to Rome and our stay at the Piazza Venezia Hotel in Rome was beyond our expectations. After reading all the reviews here before we left, we were a bit hesitant, weary and was well prepared to move to another hotel if we found it really bad. But the hotel WAS NOT as bad as other reviewers had made it to be. The entrance to the hotel is small and can easily be missed. HOWEVER, after walking around Rome, we found that the entrance is typical to most 3-4 star hotels. The location of the hotel is excellent!!!! It is about 5 minutes to the Colosseum, Palentine Hill, Trevi Fountain and maybe 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps (just depending on how fast you walk, how often you stop to admire the endless historical buildings, go to shops, etc). It is also right opposite the Roma Capitoloni (Museum - where it is nice to watch the sunset in the evening overlooking the Colosseum and Palatine Hill). Pantheon and Piazza Navona are also about 5 minutes walk away. Because the hotel is very well located, we did not need to buy any bus tickets. The only time we bought bus tickets was when we went to the Vatican and to the Termini station, only about 5 minutes bus ride. You can walk to the Vatican if you like walking and probably take 20 minutes (the 33 degrees heat prevented us from doing this). Bus stop is right outside the hotel so no need to walk far away. We loved the location of this hotel, because it gave us a chance to do all the sightseeing during the day and we were able to go back to the hotel, have a nap and freshen up for the evening. It is located in an area that never sleeps. It was always busy, just like being located in the middle of Piccadilly Circus or Leicester Square in London. We did not have a problem with the noise as the windows were double glazed so could hardly hear anything inside and had no reason to open it to get air. Bonus point of the location is that it is next to an Irish pub, Scholars Lounge! When we got to the hotel, we were welcomed by very courteous staff. We were given a welcome pack with maps and guides. We are from Asian background and we did not experience any racism. We were initially offered room 420 but having read all the bad reviews about the room before we left, we declined. They asked us to have a look and see how we feel about it and so we did...Having read all the bad reviews here about the room, we were expecting a really grotty, horrible room. When we got to the room, we were very surprised. The room WAS not as bad. The room is in the attic, very spacious, have a double bed and a single bed, big bathroom with bath and shower. The ONLY problem we saw with the room was there was no windows and if you are claustrophobic like me then the room may not be for you. We were then offered room 314. Having been given the room, we were still nervous of what the room was going to be like. But when we got there, we were welcomed with a room that was well air conditioned, double bed, flat screen tv, hangers were available to hang our clothes, mini bar, safe and abundance of hot water. The only problem we had with the room was that the shower curtain was a bit short, so everytime we had a shower, the bathroom floor was always wet. But the room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels were provided everyday. We would definitely be staying with this hotel again in the future as they are currently building a Metro right opposite the Hotel, making it a very well connected hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There are Youth Hostels in the UK that offer better accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Travellerinseat17
Reviews.Content: Having cast the requisite coins into the Trevi fountain, I hope that one day I shall return to Rome. It is a lovely and historic city. However, one place to which I shall definitely NOT be returning is the Hotel Piazza Venezia. On arrival the reception area was pleasant and the staff helpful and courteous. This therefore did nothing to prepare our party for what was to greet us on the fourth floor. As we stepped from the elevator we were hit by a wall of hot air; if we had wondered where all the heat had gone from the ground floor now we knew. The rooms were no better, and there is nothing that one can do about it, other than complain, since the air conditioning is controlled centrally. An exception is room 420 where it is controlled by what looks like a mobile phone stuck to the wall behind the lift shaft. Unfortunately we were not told about this on arrival and I spent the first night being kept awake by the heat and by what proved to be an air conditioning fan that sounded as if it were about to tear itself apart at any moment. Only by the third evening had the temperature in our rooms come down to a level at which it was worth getting into bed rather than lying on top of it. The corridor outside remained like an oven. Our rooms were dark. In most the only outside light came from a small fanlight in the sloping roof. Yes, this was a loft or attic extension. In my room the bedside lights did not work and a coil of wire protruding from the bathroom wall did not improve my confidence in the electrics. My room had no wardrobe but I was lucky and had a clothes rail below which there was a drawer. A collegue had no such luxury and lived out of a suitcase for the duration of our stay. On the first morning we found that there was no water with which to have a wash or to flush the WC. Whilst this was not the hotel's fault but due to on-going works along the road, there was no warning, and it does seem that there is a risk of a recurrence until the works are completed. Thanks to Trenitalia I still had a refreshing towel. I never thought that I would be so grateful for one. Much is made of the hotel's central position. However this is something of a red herring. Rome is such an easy city to get around. A series of well planned strolls will take in most of the sights and four euros will buy you unlimited travel for the day on the busses, even if they are rather crowded. Also, the Piazza Venezia never sleeps, so if you can open a window neither will you. The hotel offers no food. Breakfast can be provided at one of the cafes next door. However, thanks to the central position a coffee and glass of orange juice can cost you eight euros if you want to sit down. The final straw came when one of our party was charged an extra fifty euros on departure. The hotel maintained that his booking had been made separately and at a different rate. We had the confirmation of booking in writing to prove otherwise, but the hotel would have none of it and when you have a flight to catch you do not have time to argue. We were charged between 139 and 169 euros per night which was exorbitant for the standard of accomodation provided. I cannot imagine how this hotel was ever awarded three stars. Some of the staff perhaps deserve some credit for effort. However there are Youth Hostels in the UK that offer better accomodation and unless you have strong masochistic tendancies or an odd sense of humour this hotel is one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: kim7821
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel piazza venezia in Rome from June 30th till July 3rd was pleasant except for one major detail. The description of the room said air conditioned, and it was not. Although the staff was very friendly, they did nothing to remedy the situation. My first night the room was far from cool but there was air coming out of the vent. The second night I complained to the night manager, I even asked for a fan. He explained they had no fans and I could NOT change rooms because they were fully booked. The third night the room was sweltering! I went down to the desk and complained, I wrote a complaint in their hotel log, but they did not fix it, and did not have another room. The night manager even came up up to the room and said it was "really hot". He opened the skylight window but all that did was allow me to hear the loud street below. I then came down at 2:30 am to the lobby to complain again and all they said was "sorry". I hung out in the lobby for atleast an hour before retirning to my sauna of a room, i did not sleep at all. When I checked out on July 3rd I exprssed that I paid for an air conditioned room and did not have one. The manager, laura sabatini, explained that she could not give a refund because I have paid in full thru the Internet. Although the staff was friendly they did nothing to remedy the problem, never once did they check to see if the air was working or check the vent in my room. I literary could have stayed on the same block for half the price if I didnt want air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - OK Room”
Reviews.Author: amazingmuppet
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to Rome however Hotel Piazza Venezia was ok but could have been a lot more pleasant. Firstly, it is a long walk from Termini - I suggest you get the 40 or 64 bus from outside the station (we didn't realise this until we familarised ourselves with the area) and like other reviewers, we found the hotel completely by chance, it is not easy to find. We arrived at 12 but were told a room wouldn't be available until 2pm which is normal practice in many hotels I have stayed in. The receptionist gave us a map and highlighted all the main sites which was invaluable during our stay. When we returned after having lunch (avoid the restaurants outside the hotel, they are expensive and the food is poor) we were assigned room 402. After reading a previous negative review of this room, we asked the receptionist to assign us another room which he kindly did with little fuss. The room we stayed in wasn't huge and had high ceilings. After a few minutes we discovered the room didn't have air conditioning despite being advertised as having it. Rome is very hot and it did make it a little uncomfortable. Also, we were facing the main road and the noise was terrible we even had to buy ear plugs. The bathroom was tiny with a half sized bath with chipped paint. Also, large people will have difficulty sitting on the toilet as it is placed between the bath and the wall. It wasn't all bad, apart from the chipped bath, the cleaniness of the room is good with fresh sheets and a clean floor. The location is fantastic, 10 minutes to Trevi or Coloseum and a short bus ride to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality missing”
Reviews.Author: jessey
Reviews.Content: The manager, who throughout my 4 night stay was never available, needs to have a serious chat with her staff who are currently ruining what could have been a positive memorable stay, however until this is done i would stay away from the hotel. The staff are surly, abusive and very rude. being of asian background i almost feel that there is some hostility towards my race. To put it into context the receptionist feels it appropriate to swear and shout at you when you pass reception and also when asking for information feels it acceptable to ignore and not acknowledge the customer. I could go on, but from the attitude of the staff, i dont think it will help. I am however putting a formal complaint into the Italian Tourism Board and The Europian board of racial equility..... i guess that is the extent to the uncomfortableness experienced at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good for Rome”
Reviews.Author: btilli
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 402! Its an attic closet converted into a hotel room. No window...just a partial skylight. Complained about the small, hot, unventilated room. For the 2nd and 3rd nights, they moved us to one of their Suites (#2). Very nice room with balcony. Only draw back was the entrance to the room (and only "window") is the sliding glass door to patio...so concerning to leave open while asleep or away. Service was helpful and courteous. LOCATION IS PERFECT. Right in Piazza Venezia, so short walk to all major sights aside from Vatican (slightly longer walk).

Reviews.Title: “Piazza Venezia - great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: lonely_pigeon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Piazza Venezia Hotel for three nights. We were a bit sceptical before we went, having read some of the less than flattering reviews on this site. However, we were very impressed and would definitely stay there again. On arrival, we got the bus from the Termini Station (got a bit confused about buying tickets...you get them from the kiosk in the middle of the square where all the buses are). We knew we were on the right street as we were directly opposite the giant white building/memorial (Italians call it the wedding cake...you'll see why) on Piazza Venezia. However, having walked up and down the street three times we still couldn't find the hotel and started to get a bit worried. I used my very limited Italian to ask a policeman, who told me we were definitely on the right street but he had never heard of the hotel...more worry, We did eventually find it...right next to the bus stop. There was a sign, but it was just a very tiny brass plaque beside the doorway. This is my ONLY criticism of this hotel, something which could be easily rectified with an awning or larger sign over the doorway. We were met by a very polite and helpful concierge who spoke perfect English. He even took the time to point out on a map exactly where the hotel was in relation to all the main tourist attractions and sights. The entrance hall was light and clean and seemed to have been recently redecorated. Our room was on the third floor (there is a lift) and had been recently renovated. It wasn't overly large, but was certainly comfortable enough to use as a base while exploring Rome. The room and bathroom were very clean, with plenty of fresh towels and all the usual complimentary toiletries. There were only Italian TV channels, but we didn't want to waste time watching TV, so that didn't bother us. The location is unbeatable, we didn't walk for more than about 15 minutes to any of the main sights (with the exception of the Vatican, which was a 10 minute bus ride from right outside the hotel). We didn't need to use the metro at all. We didn't experience any of the problems with building work/noise that other travellers have reported - the only evidence we saw was some flat-pack furniture waiting to be put together in one of the hallways (this was well out of the way though, so didn't pose an inconvenience). Our room faced out onto a side street, so the street noise was reduced but not removed - as another reviewer has pointed out, this is the price you pay for such a central location. However, with the window closed this didn't keep us awake at night. Breakfast is not available at the hotel, but it is next door to two cafes, so that really wasn't a problem! In the larger cafe (on the right if you are facing the hotel) there is also a small shop where you can buy cigarettes, sweets and bus/metro tickets. Overall we were very happy with our stay, and would definitely use this hotel again. The location alone would have encouraged me to return, but the quality and service at the hotel (at a relatively bargain price) made me certain I'd go back. And I did throw a coin in the Trevi Fountain, so who knows... :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Ric
Reviews.Content: We want to begin by saying that we are truly grateful to the staff at Piazza Venezia. Of all the hotels that we stayed at while we were in Italy, the staff at Piazza Venezia truly went above and beyond the rest. They are truly multi-lingual. We heard one concierge coverse fluently in about four different languages. They were able to recommend restaurants where the locals eat, they taught us how to use the public transportation system, and when we had trouble with our phone card, one of them even offered to let us use his personal cell phone. When it became clear in the last minute that we needed to stay an extra night, the hotel did not have a room for us. However, one of the concierges made phone calls for us and found us a room at another hotel. He even went as far as bargaining the price down for us. The room we stayed in was clean, though the floor needed shampooing. The bathroom had been newly renovated and sparkled. There was a charming wood framed window in the bathroom to let in natural light and fresh air. Our room faced a side street, but we could still hear some street noise - it is the price you pay for the central Roman location. There's nothing anybody can do about it except to bring earplugs. Our stay in Rome was a very good one. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by Piazza Venezia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaspberryTigerUK
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for 3 nights before moving on to Venice. We arrived late and things didn't start too well as one of our cases were smashed during the flight and when we arrived at Termini station, we got in to a taxi and when we paid the guy, he said we had only given him half....it was late, dark and we very very tired, so we gave him the other half, but checked our cash later and he had done us out of an extra half of the fare, but hey, that could happen anywhere and was our mistake for not concentrating - but a warning to all when using taxis. So, the hotel. Ummmm. Tired, hungry and upset about the case and taxi, we arrived and were told they did not have a room for us for the first night and would be sending us in a taxi to another hotel - right by Termini station. Not happy, but nothing they could do and we were sent to the other hotel - Hotel Europa. The following morning after breakfast, we returned to Hotel Piazza Venezia, where I asked again why there was no room for us, knowing full well we had booked over 5 months ago and had sent an email to confirm booking two weeks before we arrived - we were informed the lock to our room had broken and couldn't be fixed in time. Whether this was true or not, we will never know....but it wasn't the best start and we felt very let down; it tarnished our stay at the hotel for the rest of our stay. The room we were put in was a refurbished room and although small, was adequate, clean and modern. I must add, it was extremely warm and where we were placed in the building had no external window (the windows looked onto a very tiny (approx 3ft square) courtyard. But, overall, the room was ok and I would be happy to stay in something similar again. Please note there is no breakfast available at the hotel. The location is perfect, it cannot be faulted, however, I doubt we will ever return to Rome, although if we ever did, we would not risk booking the Piazza Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: LeChuck
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the Piazza Venezia that is to say, just in the middle of everything. Just at a short walk from the forum, coliseum, campidoglio... They were reforming it and we stayed in one of the just new rooms, a double one, and I have to say that was cool. The toilette was big enough, but one day in the morning the water of the shower wasn´t very hot. Anyway, that happened only one day of four. We asked the service for tips about places to go (lunch, dinning, going out at night) and the advises didn´t miss the point. Really adequate if you want to see the city walking. You´ll hardly need public transport (well, maybe for the vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Porty17
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with my fiance in Sept this year whilst on a multistop holiday across Europe. Rome was the 2nd stop on our 3 stop trip and whilst I would rank the hotel 3 out of the 3 we stayed in it was still more than satisfactory. The location really is great you are walking distance to absolutely everywhere and on the main bus line so easy to catch the bus to the vatican or the train station which we did for getting back to the airport. On arrival we got a taxi from the train station so the taxi driver was able to point out the hotel to us which I must admit would have been hard to find since its just a door on the main street. Although the street was busy I must say that the noise never bothered me and we slept with the window open every night. The rooms were small but to be honest we only slept there, there is so much to do in rome that spending anymore time in the hotel other than sleeping would have been a waste! The hotel staff were really pleasant and helpful and can't fault there service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: demarky
Reviews.Content: Good points - location. Quite central no need to get metro as you can get to e'where on foot from here. This hotel is above bars in this busy piazza and only has a small plaque on the wall outside next to a single doorway so you have to look closely to find it. Rooms had maid service everyday with clean towels and beds made (see below). Bad points - advertised as having air con' - it didn't work for the entire duration of our stay which was in Sept - goodness knows what it must be like when the weather is hotter. Despite attempts for staff to get it working, it never did ,apparently, said one of the reception staff, if one half of the rooms has it, the other doesn't. Speaking to others guests theirs didn't work either. As a result the rooms were too hot to sleep well and windows couldn't be opened as it would have been too noisy. I don't believe it worked at all, be warned. Rooms are very small, you have to walk sideways to get around the bed. There is no cupboard space just a place to hang your clothes with a pull across curtain and a shelf above it. The bathroom was a small area about 3 foot by 3 foot. It had a tall shower tray (couldn't be described as a bath as it was only about a foot square). The toilet was very difficult to use as it was squashed into a small space. I'm 12.5 stone and if you're any bigger or have wider hips you're not going to be able to use it easily. The tap on the sink ran very slowly. The shower itself was good however and there was always hot water from it. The towels were like paper - very odd. For the price, this was not good value to me and it would have been better staying a little further out of the centre nr to a Metro station to get better value for money and a better hotel. I would not return. Top tip for Rome - if it's your first time - make sure you take the walking tours which will be touted to you at the colosseum etc - this gets you past the huge queues and was worth it. If it's the Pope you want to see - Wednesday is the day for the audience. It can be as expensive as you make it. All churches are free, as are the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. Have a great visit to Rome - about 3 days does it.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: XandriaHersha
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The location couldn't have been better - very near a lot of the main sights in Rome. However, this (and the friendliness of the staff) was the only redeeming feature. In the first room we had, the air conditioning didnt work and it was so small there was JUST room for a bed and a bedside cabinet. They moved us rooms for the next two nights, but they took 5 hours to get the next room ready. When we moved into this one, it was a little larger (a 'triple room' apparently) but had damp showing through the wallpaper and the toilet was leaking, so the bathroom floor was constanly awash with water. Their idea of fixing it was to stuff a towel down the back where the water was coming out. Both rooms were fairly noisy and the 'art' - well, I could have done better and I'm no artist! I would think you can do much better, even on a tight budget!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book It!”
Reviews.Author: missybeau
Reviews.Content: Supposed to be 4*. Grotty, shabby & terrible stench of sewerage. Rooms cramped & not cleaned, bathroom tiny,breakfast was only ok. Staff were lovely, this and the fact that it's smack bang in the city centre are only redeeming features. Not suitable for kids.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: IrelandJill
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that a travel agent uses this hotel. It is horrible beyond belief - no hot water, tiny dark rooms(ours had no window, just a skylight), dreadful breakfast, unhelpful staff and the most hideous decor I haver ever encountered. There were no tariffs on the doors so I do not know what they charge per night but quite frankly, I think they should have paid the guests. Don't stay here unless you are a masochist. Deeply depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Must be the WORST "hotel " in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BecsnAl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this "Hotel " and our first impression was correct .....what a dump !! I cannot honestly say what it is like to stay in this hotel, because we would never have stayed in this hotel under any circumstances !! If need be we would rather have spent the night under the stars!! We checked in and were shown to our room, it was... too small to swing the proverbial cat, the only window in the room looked out on to scaffolding covered with builders rubble, the room was dark, dirty and damp, the basin had more cracks than the Colloseum and the mini bar was locked. What constituted for a wardrobe was a curtain across a recess which housed THREE coat hangers. We walked out of the hotel and within a hundred metres or so found a lovely hotel in The Cosmapolita. To add insult to injury we paid up front for the hotel with Hotelopia ( link from Easyjet website ) and after numerous e mails we are still waiting for a full refund, promised but not received. There are probably better hotels in Bahgdad. !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare City”
Reviews.Author: ravenfeld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disaster. Here is our list of complaints: *toilet seat had large brown marks, which turned out to be scratches, although this is not what we thought at first... *toilet never flushed properly - more a bidet. Paper etc. always left in bowl. *Shower-head and connection fell on me while I was showering in microscopic bath. *Room reached temperature of 28 degrees at night. Each room does NOT have its own air con. controls. Each floor is governed by a staff-controlled switch. Since our room was a box, it was unbearable. We paid for an "air-conditioned" room and felt duped. *Staff were uncooperative, even sullen, when it came to requests or complaints. They continued to say requests would be seen to, "later". Later never came. During our 3-day stay, we saw five other guests complaining at the front desk. *Only time staff became MOST co-operative, was when we asked if they might mind our bags for us, after check-out. During our 40 minute absence, a $1200 video camera was stolen from a LOCKED cabin-bag. Only the camera and its connections were taken: then the bag was re-locked. A very professional job. Probably the worst hotel I've ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anon101
Reviews.Content: I would like to categorically say, that this has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!! I admit that the location is ideal, as everything is a short walk away, but that is no consellation for a room as dark as the London dungeon, an astronomical price for what it is and finally NO HOT WATER...... I would strongly recommend that you avoid this place unless it is absolutely necessary for you to stay within 10 mins walk of the sights. I have been to hostels that have been far more luxurious in comparison to this hotel. Hope this helps.....a better sugestion is to stay at the Hotel Teatro di Popolo near the Campo di Fioro. Which is only 10 mins walk away and is just south of Piazza Navone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - somewhere between a hostel and a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Palio Bianco for 10 days in August 2004. Booked on Octopus.com for aprox £45 a night. It was advertised as a 3 star hotel - We struggled to find it at first and were a little anxious as it clearly isn't an official hotel. The first impression was more of that of a hostel than a hotel as we had to step over people's bags to get to reception and this is where we left ours until we were allowed to check in! On arrival, we were given a tiny room (more of a storage cupboard) in the attic, with no windows other than a skylight. There was no hanging space and no drawers. The bathroom was very elegant, although that had a window overlooking a concrete enclosure. It was very claustrophobic! However, when we complained, they rushed us into another room (saying "hurry hurry, before the others arrive") and we did feel very guilty for the rest of the stay for the poor people who ended up with our first room. The new room was small but very nice with two large windows overlooking the roundabout in front of Vittorio Emanuelli monument.- it was so much better than the first room that we were pretty happy! The bathroom however was substandard - a half bath in which only cold water ran most of the time! The buffet style breakfast was quite cosy and sufficient and the staff were friendly. We were very happy with the location (just a short walk from everywhere) - you can pop back, have a shower (albeit cold most of the time!) and be at any of the squares in ten minutes on foot. On the subject of the noise, it is situated on a very busy junction, in front of the Vittorio Emanuelli monument but we enjoyed the sounds of Roman scooters and sirens and it wasn't a problem sleeping. Insomma it's really a posh youth hostel but the only possible better location would be one of the squares as although only a 10 minute walk from anywhere in Rome- there aren't any nice cafes or restaurants right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and central”
Reviews.Author: nigelfoxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and yes as previous reports say the rooms are small, but hey your in Rome! who wants to stay in your room apart from to sleep! Could not fault the cleanliness of the rooms or small bathroom. We did not find it noisy (although we were on the 4th floor -& most of the rooms on the 4th floor either have a skylight or tiny window so no noise or natural light - but the aircon was good) Staff polite but not over helpful - although ok if you push a bit for info etc. Location is excellent although entrance to Hotel is sandwiched between two restaurants so a bit hard to find initially (one of restaurants has the same name though) Probably would not stay here again but if you have booked don't worry its ok!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Castellino Palio Bianco not the best option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend the Hotel Castellino Palio Bianco unless you are simply looking for a place to keep your bags. Other than the central location, it really has nothing else of value to note. The rooms are incredibly small and should really only be sold to single travelers. The bathroom amenities worked...however, the shower faucet was dangling in a way that made bathing quite burdensome! The staff wasn't rude, but not extremely helpful either -simple requests like an extra towel and tp (because the maid forget to refill it) were not fulfilled until after several trips down to the front desk. I think its biggest downfall and also its only selling point is location. The upside is that it is easy to walk to every major site and/or catch a bus right outside the hotel's front door if your legs need a break. The downside, is that it's unreasonably noisy 24 hours a day! Ambulance sirens, car horns, you name it...sleeping at any time of day is difficult. With all the options in Rome, I do not recommend this hotel. Maybe if the price to value ratio made sense, but I paid 160euro a night for a glorified closet on the noisiest street in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For location and price alone I would stay here again. It was €95 per night in March for a double room. It is located virtually across the road from the Emmanuelle Vittorio monument, 15 mins walk from the Coloseum, Pantheon, Trevi fountain. Piazza Navona and Spanish steps a little further and the Vatican around 30 mins walk. Just as well really, there's no metro any closer than that of the Coloseum! On arrival, the male receptionist wasn't the most friendly. Then again, he wasn't rude either, and was happy for us to change rooms when we discovered we couldn't open the shutters fully due to scaffolding outside, thus leaving the room in darkness. (It also had a "half" bath, instead of shower.) The next room was exactly the same layout, adequate, although it looks as if they bought their fabric in bulk - EVERYTHING is covered in the same stuff - the bed, tables, headboard, curtains, the curtain serving as a wardrobe door (!).... The bathroom, apart from having super spotlights, was poor - the shower tray wasn't deep enough and as there was only a wrap-around curtain that didn't quite reach the bottom, the bathroom was flooded at every use. The shower head was caked with limescale, so the water simply fell on you rather than flowed! At least there was plenty of hot water! Breakfast was ok, not much in the way of choices; Croissants, bread rolls, cornflakes, chocolate cornflakes, coffee and radio-active looking juice (suspiciously like that dreadful Sunny Delight stuff!) On the whole it was ok. If all you need is somewhere to re-charge after an active day's sightseeing (and with all that walking you need to recharge!) then it's fine. Just take a mop for the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good room, clean, pleasent staff”
Reviews.Author: RomanticRomeo
Reviews.Content: Step out and you view the magesty of the Piazza Venezia. What a location! very close to treve, collusem et al. rooms are v small and clean, but what do you expect, you are in ROME, one of the most anceint romantic cities in the world!! staff were friendly (as much as italians can be) and answered our questions politely. intersting artwork, and a wee but rough round the edges, but thats a small sacrafice. cafe next door is great for a cappachino & pizza slice. ---- Why is it only the no-Euros who leave bad reviews for hotels like this??

Reviews.Title: “Great Location pity about the room size !”
Reviews.Author: mikey393
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel whilst attending a business conference in Rome. When I arrived I was told by a colleague that there had been no hot water for 3 days so to be cautious about trying to have a shower! At best the water was luke warm during my stay. The room was very basic & small & the bathroom so restricted that you couldn't even swing the proverbial cat ! The hotel needs a complete refurbishment. Forget the breakfast, rock hard rolls & pretty disgusting coffee. On the plus side, great position in the centre facing the Piazza Venezia & the staff were friendly & helpful. Obviously, a management problem that needs sorting out. I booked via Octopus who were v.helpful, baring in mind they are only the "middleman" here & have to negotiate with the hotel on you behalf. I have just been offered & have accepted their compensation today.

Reviews.Title: “Fire hazard?!”
Reviews.Author: chelseatraveller121
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome in the middle of the night to a tiny, claustrophobic room. The toilet leaked, the floor was dirty, it was in the attic, we had booked for a twin room and were given a double bed, but the worst thing of all..... the room had no window! surely against all fire regulations! it was nothing more than a glorified store room. The night porter arranged for the manager of the Hiberia Hotel to take us there, which was a super hotel round the corner. we booked the holiday with Octopus and Airmiles and therefore expected some sort of standard. The hotel then had the cheek to say they had offered us a better room, but thank goodness the night porter was honest. One month later we are still waiting for Octopus to respond, after paying our money up front! do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: mrsltaylor
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this hotel I decided to take a chance and book it (due to price and location). We arrived with low expectations but was pleasantly surprised. Yes the rooms are small (and bathrooms are even smaller) but they are clean and have everything you need. The staff were frienldy and helpful, always on the desk and ready to help whenever you came down the stairs or out of the lift. The only downsides were the bathroom - could do with some repair work around the bath; and it was quite comical watching my 6ft 1 husband try and shower in the little sit down bath (was absolutely fine for me!); and breakfast - it was a little hit and miss whether you'd get a table with plates & knifes and if there was any bread or juice left (but very tasty when was there). But all in all, the location is GREAT, rooms clean and comfortable and for only 65 pounds per night you can't complain! Arrive with reasonable expectations and you won't have any problems. I'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just HORRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DREADFUL is the word to describe this place. During our 4-night-stay nothing went right: claustrophobic room, leaking toilet, no warm water, very poor service, lift without light inside, inefficient staff, noisy..., and so on. This so-called "hotel" is completely overpriced, and the only good point about it is the location. We stated a letter of complaintment at the reception desk (they didn't even have the compulsory complaintement papers) and have done the same in our travel agency. Our piece of advice is :Avoid it!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: marnei
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. We were booked for 4 nights but stayed only one and then only because we arrived at 1 a.m. The rooms were filthy, we did not dare use the shower, what there was of it, we slept on top of the bed as the sheets were stained. We did not touch breakfast which was served in the corridor outside our room. We booked through Octupus travel who were very unhelpful and had to find ourselves other accommodation. This hotel says its 3 star and charges accordingly. I wouldnt even give it 1 star. There are plenty other 3 star hotels in Rome near the Spanish Steps which are worthy of their rating.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 years ago and it was very run down then. The web site stated that it had been refurbished so we booked again but found it terrible The bath was chipped and there was nohing to hold up the shower. The rooms were drab and the lift broke down on the day we were leaving, we were on the 3rd floor. Location is the only thing this hotel has going for it and it is overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here it's horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on the location- central rome etc- the web photos looked superb- what a bargain! When we got there we found a dingy, tatty hotel and had to change rooms due to our first room having no useable shower. The breakfasts were poor. We have stayed in far better in Rome and I would advise you not to stay here- we certainly won't be doing when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Time and non-maintenance have taken their toll”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This may have been a 3 star hotel in a previous life but certainly isn't one now. We viewed 3 rooms before having to choose the best of the worst. The following issues are applicable to all the rooms we saw: The bathrooms are tiny with baths the size of shower bases. This would have been fine had there been a plug to allow filling with water. There was no plug for the sink basin either.. There is air-con but not all are controllable, some of the mini-bar fridges work, none of the mini-safes did at all. There may be satellite TV but i didn't see it. Our final choice room had a massive 2 channels as standard though I found an extra sports channel and a German home shopping channel by re-tuning! Repairs were promised "Domani" but "tomorrow" never came... The location is great though and in the centre of the city and great for walking to pretty much all of the sites, just watch out for the crazy Italian drivers and moped riders, they don't stop at the pedestrian crossings! Down-side is the rooms are therefore close to noisy nocturnal activities. If you're used to backpacker hostels this will be fine but not at the price. If you are used to real 3+ star hotels you will be dissappointed. Another guest who had used this hotel 2 years previous (under different management) confirmed our view of the hotel over our final breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: stevie65000
Reviews.Content: friendly staff,superb location easy walk to trevi ,colliseum,spanish steps etc.breakfast enough to get you started for the day.crazy artwork adds to the charm of this 2 star hotel ,great hotel if you dont spend too much time in your room,i would gladly stay again if only for the location .

Reviews.Title: “Fun, weird and a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Rud-gr
Reviews.Content: As many other readers I was a bit worried about some of the comments about the hotel that I found here. We took the gamble and we were glad we did. Even though we knew we had to look for the entrance very well we still managed to miss it twice. No big deal because we didn't walk far away. In case you want to know: it's exactly next to the sandwich/chocolate/coffee place on the corner. (left hand side, when facing the shop) Staff was perfectly helpful and friendly all the time and the entrance is small but very nice. And then... the amazing artworks of this place! We LOVED it! Let's just say some of it is rather unusual but it gives a great atmosphere to the place. There's something to discover in any corner. The location: it's hard to find a better place at these prices. Walk out of the hotel, cross the street and you are facing over 2000 years of history instantly with the Forum Romano at your feet and the Colosseum dominating the background. The rooms are a bit smallish but have convenient storage space. The TV only had a few channels but who is going to watch TV in a city that's called Rome?! Our bathroom was in need of a bit of a redo but that was basically the only negative that I can tell about the hotel. Breakfast is basic but nice and the coffee was pretty good and unlimited. If you're looking for some really, really, really good food for amazing prices: just around the corner of the hotel go find "l'Archetto". It's about 4-5 minutes behind the hotel and get there in time because it's insanely busy (on weekends at 8pm you might find more than 25 people OUTSIDE waiting to get in!!!). Highly recommendable and they do speak english over there. Location: ***** Room: *** (depending on your bathroom) Price: **** Rutger Geerling Travel writer- and photographer ------

Reviews.Title: “quirky & great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Patjo818DerbyEngland
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 1am the hotel didn't seem that welcoming. The ride up to the fourth floor in the glass lift was slightly unnerving!! The artwork and ambience was decidedly weird and slightly spooky - especially the very dark looking picture on our bedroom wall! But first impressions were deceptive - the hotel was very clean and comfortable, the bedroom was very small -but the bed was big and the tiny skylight (instead of a window) kept the noise down to a minimum. Breakfast was basic but filling & the coffee hot & tasty. The location was brilliant. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Without The Frills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the price. The location is awesome. Remember you are not going to Rome to stay in the hotel room. The rooms are small but all you need is a bed, tv, phone, and a bathroom with a shower. Guess what, it has all of these amenities! Enjoy your stay here. I loved it and would recommend it to anyone. If you are someone who likes the fluffy amenities DO NOT stay here. Enjoy Rome not the hotel. Explore and enjoy the Italian culture. FORZA AZZURRI!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Pastygirl
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers, that after reading some comments I was dreading my stay at this hotel. I have to say it's probably not an English 3 star hotel, more of a 2.5, but having said that, the rooms, although small, were clean. The bathroom may need updating, but it had a bath and shower and a hairdryer. There was no safe deposit box, so it might be a tip to take some form of wallet to look after your essential paperwork while staying there. The breakfast was rolls, jam etc, some cereal and coffee/tea, which kept us going until lunchtime. I have to say the best thing this hotel offers is most definately its position. So close to so many sights. The bus stop is outside the hotel, so with the window open you have a lot of traffic noise, but it is double glazed and no noise is apparant once the window is closed. Use this hotel as a base, (not an all day refuge) and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently situated near the Via Corso and the Trajan Forum, and is only about 10/15 mins walk from the Colosseum. It's also near the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. In terms of location the hotel is excellent. The breakfast is basic and our room was small but functional with a bathroom, shower, fridge, TV, and view of the piazza. If you're after a luxurious hotel then this isn't the one for you, but if you're more interested in the world outside your room then this is good budget accommodation. The artwork is certainly an experience; we reckon it must all be the owner's own work. Don't take it seriously and you'll enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this estalishment for three nights in August 2004 and was quite shocked by the low standards. the bathroom like that of other reviewers had a leaking shower which flooded the room, but more scarily, the single room which i was staying in, contained an internal door, presumably, the small room i occupied had originally been connected to the one next door. As a young girl staying on her own, the only time i have ever felt afraid whilst travelling. occurred on a nightly basis when the residents of the room next door tried to open the blocked up door, (they often nearly succeeded due to their force!!!). this worried me just for personal safety but also security for my possessions. another feature which led to sleepless nights was the paper thin walls, don't worry about having a TV in your room, because once your neighbours have one, you'll be entertained!!! in addition to this, some people have already commented on the breakfasts, i have to admit i don't know what they're like, due to the fact that those lovely paper like walls and the strange layout meant that the head of my bed was closest to the walls of my neighbours bathroom, so daily, i was awoken by the not so appetising sounds of their bowel movements. don't settle for this because of the location!!! there's many better hotels out there in Rome

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Sparky041
Reviews.Content: Pro: Cheap! Great location, Clean room, Minibar not overpriced (not cheap either though) digital combination safe in the room, adequate continental breakfast I've had worse! most staff speak English, the weird decor adds some humour. Cons: Difficult to find without a sign outside (I walked for half an hour passing it twice). The street noise can bother a light sleeper

Reviews.Title: “Strange Hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: Maz9
Reviews.Content: June 04. Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and can agree with most of the comments made previously. The 'artwork' looks like students have been left in there with a free hand!! But, if you want a cheap hotel that is perfectly central to all the major attractions in Rome then this is the one. I don't think you could find a better placed hotel and the Piazza Venetzia is stunning at night. Colesseum - 10 - mins Vatican - 20 mins It can't be described as a 3 star, I would put the rating as 2 star. The rooms are okay if you are aiming to be sightseeing most of the day and just need a place to wash and to sleep. Don't bother with breakfast. It can't even be classed as a continental breakfast and if you are lucky enough to be looked after by the Italian version of Manuel, who when asked for cups, knives etc, complained he was too busy and disappeared!!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Forum, 100 yards. Colloseum, 700 yards. Trevi Fountain, 5 minutes walk. Via del Corso, 20 second's walk. How can you complain? Yes, the room was small, but I asked for an outward facing window and the view was great. Yes, the bathroom was small, but it worked perfectly. The bed was comfy, the art was... interesting. Some of it was laughable and the picture in my room was so horrible I photographed it to scare cats from the garden. BUT THIS HOTEL IS 150% character. Take a look at the location and the price tag. Read the small print on check-in times and remember that Italians have a siesta in the afternoon. If you pan this hotel because you don't get a side-order of fries with the mini-bar, you're missing the point. This is what city breaks on foot are all about. Above all, try saying Buon Giorno, smile and you'll find you are dealing with nice people, too. If you want the Rome experience without the city of Rome but you like candy floss with everything, go to a theme park. Otherwise, try this hotel. I can't guarantee you'll like it but you'll never stop talking about it. Holidays are about memories, not snap-albums. I loved it. So, why didn't I give it full marks? It was that green picture in my room with the two black and white faces. The one at the front was smiling but the one at the back... Let me look at the picture again... Oh Lordy!
